Lourdes is studying at university; she is in her second year.  At home she raises animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  On weekends she serves in a bar.  She has been doing this job for seven years.

This is Lourdes' fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying chickens and guinea pigs.

Lourdes' goal is to grow in her animal raising business and to finish her university course.

loans.use: to buy chicken and guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase balanced feed, utensils, chairs and supplies to continue preparing the food that she sells.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia tiene 22 años de edad, convive con Lázaro que también 26 años, con quien tiene un hijo, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Celedonia es una mujer perseverante en sus quehaceres, es por esta razón que viene  obteniendo sus objetivos trazados. Ella es trabajadora del municipio, donde brinda servicios de limpieza. Esta a gusto con su trabajo por que gracias a ello puede ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que también aporta en la canasta familiar. En un futuro próximo piensa abrir un pequeño restaurante, de esta manera desea ser independiente, por que en el barrio por donde vive no existe un servicio de este rubro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará muebles para acondicionar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Celedonia is 22 years old and lives with 26 year-old Lázaro.  The couple have one son.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.

Celedonia is a woman who determinedly does her work.  For this reason, she is achieving the goals that she has set herself.  She works for the council, providing cleaning services.  She enjoys her work because it enables her to help with her household expenses.  She has the support of her husband who also contributes to the family's expenses.  In the near future, she plans to open a small restaurant so that she be self employed.  There is currently no business of this type in the neighborhood where she lives.

This is Celedonia's first loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy furniture to set up her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rings, earrings, chains, bracelets, and chokers, among other items.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Josesito de Cumbe, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este  lugar es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad.

Doña Zoila tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 21 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad y su segunda hija en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo construida por el trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Zoila labora en la agricultura labrando sus tierras y también se dedica a la cría de animales como cerdos, cuyes y pollos, sus productos y animales los vende en su comunidad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para crecer un poco más en la crianza de estos animales.

Su meta es construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila is a member of the Josesito de Cumbe community bank.  She lives in Cumbe parish, a lovely place with a cold climate and a place of much natural beauty for visitors.  Local people make their living from farming, raising animals and work in the city.  

Dona Zoila, 49, is married.  She and her husband have 2 daughters, 21- and 17-years old.  Her older daughter is studying at the university and her younger daughter is in high school.  Her husband is a construction worker and they built the house where the live together.  

Sra. Zoila owns land that she farms.  She also operates a business, raising and selling animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  She sells the animals locally.  

She's been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she will use this loan to buy guinea pigs that she will raise and sell when they're ready for market.

Her goal is to build another house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Susana y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 62 años edad, soy casada, tengo tres hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la agricultura”.

Susana es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene terrenos de cultivos de frutas como mangos, naranjas, limones y también café y cacao. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.
texts.en:
(Quillabamba is the capital of La Convencion province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convencion valleys.  The local people make a living growing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.)
We visited the Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan community bank in Quillabamba and met Susana, a member of the bank:

"I was born in Quillabamba, I'm 62 years old, I'm married, I have three children, I live in the city where I was born and I operate an animal-sales business".

Susana is a determined and enterprising woman who has managed to support her children despite all the obstacles she's faced.  She owns land where she grows fruit such as mangos, oranges, lemons and even coffee and cacao.  She will use this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs for her aniimal-sales business.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa tiene 65 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Nueva Esperanza del Distrito D. TambogranD.. Su comunidad es zona rural  D. este distrito por lo que aún no cuenta  con servicios básicos.

María Josefa se dedica a la comercialización D. ganado ovino, además cría aves D. corral como gallinas y patos los cuales cría y engorda y cuando estos se encuentran en un peso y tamaño apropiado los comercializa en el mercado local  o con sus vecinos y amigos, esta actividad la desarrolla desD. hace mas D. 5 años, en la parte posterior D. su domicilio, 

María Josefa esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 para que pueda comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. su ganado y aves para que D. esta manera pueda venderlos a un mejor precio y así seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria Josefa is 65, married, and has 3 children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the hamlet of Nueva Esperanza, in the TambogranD. district. Her community is a rural zone of this district, and for this reason she does not have basic services.

Maria Josefa sells sheep, and also raises barnyard birds such as hens and ducks, which she raises and fattens. When they reach an appropriate weight and size, she sells them in the local market or to neighbours and friends. She has had this business for over five years, and runs it in the back of her home.

Maria Josefa is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can purchase balanced feed for fattening her livestock and birds, so that she can sell them at a better price and thus continue expanding her business. This will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening her livestock.

loans.name: Dolores Azuncion

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal Josesito de Cumbe, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad.

La Señora Dolores tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa junto con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Dolores se dedica a la cría de animales como son ganado, cuyes y gallinas, también labora en la agricultura, todo sus productos y animales los vende en su comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su quinto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the 'Josesito de Cumbe' community bank and lives in Cumbe parish.  This area has a cold climate but also beautiful places to visit where people can enjoy being close to nature.  The locals raise animals, farm and many go and work in the city every day.

Dolores is 41 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 22, 18 and 16.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her other two children are in school.  She does not own her own home but lives together with her mom and shares the household expenses.

Dolores raises livestock such as guinea pigs and hens.  She also farms.  She sells all of her products and animals in her community.

This is Dolores' fifth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying chickens so that she can start this business activity.

Dolores' dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es: El Sr. Hipólito es  muy trabajador y se  preocupa  por el  bienestar de su  familia  ya  que  esta  representa  lo mas importante  en la  vida, día  con  día el lucha  por el  acondicionamiento  de su  vivienda   es  por ello  que  en esta  ocasión necesita  de  nuestra  ayuda para  realizar acabados  en la  barda  delantera  de  su  domicilio ya  que se preocupa de que  sus  pequeños  se  puedan  salir de su  domicilio ocasionando  un  accidente, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Hipólito is a hardworking gentleman who is concerned about the welfare of his family since they represent the most important thing in life. Every day he struggles to provide a comfortable home for them. On this occasion, he needs assistance with completing a security wall to the side of his house. He is worried that his small children will get out of the house and cause an accident.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Betty Betzayda

texts.es: La señora Betty , es habitante del municipio de Masaya , junto a su esposo  e hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan ser unos profesionales , doña Betty desde hace  varios años se dedica a la costura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un ingreso suficiente para ir mejorando su vivienda , agradece Afodenic ya que atrávez de fondo Kiva , su condición de vida va cambiando poco apoca ya que en financiamientos anteriores logro realizar el baño y otras mejoras de la vivienda , ahora quiere el financiamiento para la compra de cerámica , puerta , inodoro , etc. .
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a resident of the town of Masaya. She lives with her husband and children. Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions and support her children so that they can become professionals. Doña Betty has been a seamstress for several years. Her greatest difficulty is not having enough money to make improvements to her home. She is grateful that AFODENIC is making Kiva funds available.

Her living conditions are gradually changing since her previous loans where used to install a bathroom and make other home improvements. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ceramic tiles, a door, a toilet, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic tiles, a door, a toilet, and other items.

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras.  El coordinador del grupo es el señor  Damaso Abba, él es agricultor de maíz, frijoles, trigo…etc. Además de eso el comercializa granos básicos desde hace varios años en su hogar y en mercado de Masaya. 
El con el crédito comprara granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz, trigo…etc.) 
Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Luisa  comerciante de calzado de manera ambulante y Robando es propietario de una zapatería desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The group “Primero Dios” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. The group coordinator is Sr. Damaso Abba. He is a farmer who grows corn, beans, wheat, and other crops. In addition, he has been selling dry goods for several years from his home and at the market in Masaya. He will use his loan to buy dry goods such as rice, beans, corn, wheat, and other items.

The other members are María Lusia, a traveling shoe merchant, and Roblando, who has owned a shoemaking business for eight years.

loans.use: to buy dry goods such as rice, beans, corn, wheat, and other items.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel Antonio es un señor de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y dos hijos uno de diez y el otro de once años de edad, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
El se dedica a la agricultura. El su producto a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente Miguel está solicitando un microcrédito de₡460.000 (cuatrocientos sesenta mil colones), para la siembra de yuca uno de los mas deliciosos tubérculos en el país. 
Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos a la hora de la cosecha. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
 Miguel es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio is a 40-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 11.  They reside in a small community called Trinchera de Pital, which is located in Alajuela Province.  The main business activities in the area are livestock breeding and agriculture, particularly pineapple cultivation.  Most of the products are sold primarily to international markets.  For this reason, community development has increased in recent years as the increased growth in the demand for goods and services has resulted in more job opportunities.  

Miguel is a farmer.  His neighbors in the community are satisfied with the quality of his products.  At the moment, Miguel is requesting a microloan of 460,000 CRC for growing cassava, one of the most delicious tubers that are produced in Costa Rica.  With this investment, he hopes that his micro-enterprise will grow so that he can serve more customers and offer better products at harvest time.  All of these factors will help improve his living conditions.  

Miguel is a member of the Successful Women’s Communal Credit Enterprise of Trinchera de Pital, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level.  In addition, Miguel is an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing cassava.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital D. Provincia D. La Convención e importante centro D. comercio D. las valles D. Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción D. coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad D. Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes D. Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Vilma y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad D. Quillabamba, tengo 46 años edad, es viuda, tengo tres hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donD. nací y mi actividad principal es la agricultura”.

Vilma es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar D. las adversidades saca adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene terrenos D. cultivos D. achote, yuca, café y cacao. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento D. sus cultivos como por ejemplo abonos e insecticida.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención Province and an important commercial center for Lares and La Convención Valleys. The main business activities involve coca leaf, coffee, cacao, and fruit production. The staff of Asociación Arariwa went to Quillabamba to visit the Communal Bank “Los Corazones Valientes D. Morrow San Juan” (The Valiant Hearts of Morro San Juan) and met Vilma, one of its members. She said the following:

“I was born in the city of Quillambamba. I am 46 years, a widow, and have three children. I live in the same city where I was born. My main business activity is agriculture.”

Despite the adversity she faces, Vilma is a determined and enterprising woman who is able to move her family forward. She has land on which she grows annatto, cassava, coffee, and cacao. Vilma is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies for maintaining her crops such as composts and insecticides.

loans.use: to purchase composts and insecticides.

loans.name: Letty María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Puerto Real.

En este lugar conocimos a Letty, tiene 43 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su mamá.

Ella es propietaria de un edificio en el cual tiene departamentos para alquilar, nos cuenta que utiliza los créditos para invertirlos en arreglar dichos departamentos y darles más comodidad a sus inquilinos pero también esto le deja mejores ganancias a la vez. Con este crédito que esta por recibir ella va a arreglar algunas ventanas que están un poco deterioradas en dos departamentos que están desocupados, espera que con los arreglos que está haciendo arrendarlos muy pronto y a muy buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar 5 ventanas de vidrio que le hacen falta para dar mayor conformidad y seguridad a  sus inquilinos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son sumamente bajos en relación a los bancos tradicionales.
 
Sus metas son tener arrendados todos sus departamentos muy pronto.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Puerto Real” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantity of tamarind fruit that is produced during this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Letty. She is 43 years old, single, and lives with her mother. Letty is the owner of a building that has floors for rent. She has used the loans to invest in repairs of the various floors so that she can make them more comfortable for her tenants and generate more revenue. With the loan she will receive, Letty will replace a few windows that have deteriorated on two floors that are vacant. She hopes that making the repairs will allow her to rent them out quickly at a very good price.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of five glass windows so that her tenants will have greater comfort and security. Letty has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the interest rates are lower than traditional banks.

Her goals include making repairs to all of the floors in her building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase five windows.

loans.name: Aura Gregoria

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 47 años de edad,  vive con sus hijos, quienes le apoyan en  su negocio. Vive en el distrito de Cayalti,contanto en su vivienda con los servicios básicos de agua y energia electrica, su comunidad esta dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Aurora se dedica hace varios años a la venta de refrescos y bebidas de diferentes sabores, en el exterior del mercado llamado La Parada  en el mismo distrito de Cayalti. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera diaria a los trabajadores de dicho mercado y a personas que concurrentes al mismo.
   
Aurora desea comprar más insumos, como cebada , soya, entre otros  para la preparación de sus bebidas y para surtir su negocio y preparar bebidas de otros sabores, ella piensa  aumentar su margen de ventas por ello esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles ,para cumplir con sus objetivo.

Aurora es una persona con buenas referencias, ella  tiene  una familia unida, además demuestra tener buen caracter y ser responsable.
texts.en:
Aurora is 47. She lives with her children, who support her in her business. She lives in the Cayalti district and has her own home with basic water and electric services. The residents of her community work in trade, agriculture and livestock.

Aurora has sold pop and drinks of various flavours for several years. She sells outside of the La Parada market in the Cayalti district, where she lives. She offers her products daily to the workers and customers of the market.

Aurora wants to purchase more supplies, such as barley and soy, for making her drinks, and to stock her business and prepare drinks of other flavours. She plans to increase her sales margin, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve her goal.

Aurora has good references. She has a united family and has demonstrated herself to have a good character and to be responsible.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing her drinks.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; la socia tiene 35 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 2 hijos y ella se dedica a la administración y atención de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja todo el día atendiendo su tienda, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad; la socia desea comprar arroz, fideos, aceites entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. Valentina manages and attends to a grocery store. She works every day looking after her store. Valentina wants to invest this loan in the purchase of basic necessity products. She plans to buy rice, noodles, oil, and other items. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase these basic necessities.

Valentina has demonstrated that she is pleased with and appreciative of the support that has been provided in this manner. She promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Audelio

texts.es:
Audelio tiene 59 años de edad tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo  el cuenta con casa propia en la que reside junto a su familia , su vivienda se localiza en el departamento de Piura  al norte del país en el distrito de Morropón   

Audelio desde hace 11 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Morropón, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  

Aurelio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, además también desea realizar algunas mejoras  en su vivienda para su mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Aurelio es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Audelio is 59 and has 4 children, of whom 2 are under his care. He has his own home where he lives with his family. His home is located in the Piura department in the north of the Morropon district.

Audelio has raised and sold sheep and barnyard birds for 11 years. His corral is located in an external part of his home. He feeds his animals balanced food and natural grains. Once they reach an ideal level of development he offers them for sale to the locals or in the Morropon market. With the income that he obtains he covers his familial obligations.

Audelio has requested a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more balanced feed in order to keep the animals well-fed. This way she will be able to sell them at a better price to his customers in order to cover his loan and improve his family's quality of life. He also wants to make some home improvements for greater security and comfort. Aurelio is a hard-working and very responsible person, and the only thing that he wants is for his children to have other opportunities for education.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his animals, and to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Aura Leonor

texts.es: La señora Aura , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto sus hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar en sus estudio a su pequeña hija la cual estudia , desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y de segunda , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue la muerte de su esposo ; ya que él era un gran apoyo en la familia y ahora tiene que luchar solo para poder mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , agradece Afodenic  que atrávez de fondos Kiva  los comerciante puedan mejorar la infraestructura de la casa ya que el préstamo lo quiere para realizar una división  y compra zinc por que el que tiene actualmente está muy deteriorado .
texts.en: Mrs. Aura is a resident of the Ticuantepe municipality. Together with her children, she plans to improve her family's living conditions and support her young daughter in her studies. For several years she has sold new and second-hand clothing. Her greatest hurdle has been the death of her husband, as he was a great support for the family. She now has to fight on her own  to improve the conditions of their home. She thanks Afodenic that, through Kiva, businesspeople are able to improve the infrastructure of their homes. She needs this loan to put up a division in her home and to purchase zinc, because what she currently has is very deteriorated.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Liliam Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 05 hijos, vive en casa propia la misma que solo cuenta con solo los servicios básicos de agua y energía eléctrica, su casa se localiza en el distrito de Tambogrande. 

Mercedes cuenta con un establecimiento de venta de pollo a la braza en su polleria, ella ofrece esta comida desde hace más de 10 años, en  su propio domicilio, donde atiende todos los días de la semana a clientes conocidos. Cuenta con ambiente y material adecuado para su negocio, en el que desea . seguir creciendo. 

Mercedes esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería en insumos (pollo, arroz, etc) y  mejoras en local y por  ende seguir creciendo en sus  ventas diarias y en su actividad. 

Mercedes tiene muchas ganas d que sus negocio siga creciendo, para ello trabaja diariamente, ya que sus finalidad es poder ayudar a su esposo al sostenimiento de sus hogar , para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 60. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in her own home, which only has basic water and electricity services. Her home is in the Tambogrande district.

Mercedes sells grilled chicken. She has done this for over 10 years out of her home. She tends to her regulars every day of the week. Her business has a good atmosphere and is well-furnished. She wants her business to continue growing.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of supplies (chicken, rice, etc) and for improvements to her place of business. Her goal is for her daily sales and her business to grow.

Mercedes has a great desire for her business to continue growing. With this in mind she works every day, since her goal is to be able to help her husband to maintain their household, in order to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for preparing food.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  14 y 10 años las mismas que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un bar en un colegio de la localidad el cual administran juntos, allí venden muchos bocadillos y bebidas, en su bar los estudiantes pueden encontrar empanadas, sanduches, corviches, sodas, jugos naturales entre otras cosas, además de esto los fines de semana ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y estas ventas las realiza puerta a puerta, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos ya que les da a muy buen precio y con comodidades de pago. Lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y 5 años en el bar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y productos como sodas, jugos, empanadas, golosinas, etc. para surtir el bar. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta la ayuda que le dan en el mismo.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender sus productos y un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madres Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mothers for a Better Future) meets every 15 days in the May 24th canton in Manabí Province. This area is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, the variety of animal life, and the friendly and hardworking people who make their living through agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Maritza. She is 32 years old, married, and has two daughters (ages 14 and 10) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Maritza and her husband manage a snack bar at a high school in their town. There they sell many foods and beverages. At their snack bar, students can order empanadas, sandwiches, “corviches” (fish fritters), sodas, natural juices, and other items. In addition, Maritza sells all types of clothes on the weekends and generates her sales by going door-to-door. She says that her customers place many orders with her because she offers them a good price and convenient payment options. Maritza has been selling clothes for seven years and has managed her snack bar for five years.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing and product such as sodas, juices, empanadas, candy, and other items to restock her snack bar. Maritza has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dreams are to have a shop where she can sell clothes and to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, empanadas, candy, and other items to restock her snack bar and to acquire clothing to sell on the weekends.

loans.name: Hector Noel

texts.es:
Héctor, de 42 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene tres hijos de 19,14y 9 años  de edad respectivamente el mayor de sus hijos juega en un equipo de beisbol, los otros dos estudian. Héctor es carpintero, aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre pues antes era el quien dirigía el negocio familiar con el paso del tiempo su padre se lo dejo de herencia y así ha venido surgiendo poco a poco de este negocio alimenta y viste a su familia.
El solicito el préstamo para comprar materia prima como clavos, pega, tornillos y madera para elaborar puertas, ventanas, roperos, sillas. El desea no solo mejorar la calidad de su trabajo si no darlo a conocer en toda la ciudad, pues desea incrementar el numero de clientes, hacerle mejoras su local, comprar maquinaria nueva y moderno que la ayuden a cumplir su trabajo de forma rápida y eficiente  y apoyar a sus tres campeones sus hijos.
texts.en:
Héctor is 42 years old and lives in the city of León.  He has three children aged 19, 14 and 9.  The eldest of his children plays on a baseball team and the other two are in school.  Héctor is a carpenter.  He learned the trade from his father who used to run the family business.  Over time, his father left the business to Héctor who has been making gradual progress in it.  The business feeds and clothes his family.

Héctor requested this loan to buy raw materials such as nails, adhesive, screws and wood for making doors, windows, wardrobes and chairs.  He would like not only to improve the quality of his work but also to become known throughout the city as he would like to increase his number of customers, make some improvements to his premises, buy new and modern machinery which will help him to do his work quickly and efficiently, and support his three champions - his children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as nails, adhesive, screws and wood to make doors, windows, wardrobes and chairs

loans.name: Lucy Marina

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Lucy Marina y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 30 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria”.

Lucy Marina es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a su familia. Ella vende ropa como por ejemplo vestidos, pantalones y polos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo polos, vestidos y etc. El sueño de la socia Lucy Marina es tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención Province and an important commercial center for Lares and La Convención Valleys. The main business activities involve coca leaf, coffee, cacao, and fruit production. The staff of Asociación Arariwa went to Quillabamba to visit the Communal Bank “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” (The Valiant Hearts of Morro San Juan) and met Lucy Marina, one of its members. She said the following:

“I was born in the city of Quillambamba. I am 30 years old and live in the same city where I was born. My main business activity is selling clothes as a street vendor.”

Despite the adversity she faces, Lucy Marina is a determined and enterprising woman who is able to move her family forward. She sells clothing such as dresses, trousers, and polo shirts. Lucy is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, dresses, and other items. Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell such as dresses, polo shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Paso Real Group

texts.es: Maritza Esperanza, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Paso Real, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, y reside en la Aldea Pálala. Maritza es una persona de muy escasos recursos económicos pero también es muy luchadora y desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y ahora que es madre soltera lo hace para sus hijos. Desde hace unos años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa americana usada de forma ambulante, sus pequeños hijos la ayudan a cargar la ropa y junto con ella recorren las calles de la comunidad donde residen y también las comunidades aledañas para realizar las ventas de casa en casa. Con el préstamo solicitado Maritza comprará un fardo de ropa usada de la temporada (suéteres, chamarras, gorros, sombrillas, etc.) y así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes variedad en estilos. Ella está segura que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ventas aumentaran y por tanto sus ingresos también.  Su sueño es ampliar su casa para instalar un pequeño local y ya no salir junto con sus hijos a la calle para realizar sus ventas. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cancelar las cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Maritza Esperanza is a member of the Solidarity Group “Paso Real”. She is 41 years old and a single mother with three children. They reside in La Aldea Pálala. Maritza is a determined individual even though she has very limited financial resources. At a very young age, she learned how to work in order to help her parents. Now she is a single mother who does what she can for her children. A few years ago, Maritza began selling used American clothing as a street vendor. Her children help her with carrying the clothes and together they walk through the streets of their community. They also travel to the neighboring communities and generate sales by going house to house.

With the loan she requested, Maritza will buy a bundle of used seasonal clothing (sweaters, jackets, caps, umbrellas, and other items) so that she can offer her customers a variety of styles. She is confident that the assistance from this loan will increase her sales and her income. Her dream is to expand her house so that she can open a small store and not have to travel through the streets with her children in order to make sales. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to submit her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: La señora Dora, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la agricultura , especialmente al cultivo de pitahaya , la mayor afectación que se le presento fue que no logro inducir en tiempo y forma provocando que la fruta saliera en mal estado y su precio no valía en mercado , el motivo que le llevo a esta mala producción  fue la pérdida de su esposo  debido a la enfermedad que sufría , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva dándole la oportunidad de un financiamiento para continuar su vida de agricultora y salir hacia adelante después de todo lo sucedido .
texts.en: Mrs. Dora is a resident of the Ticuantepe municipality. Her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions. She has worked in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of dragon fruit, for a long time. Her greatest problem has been that she was not able to plant on time, which meant that the fruit came out in bad condition and had little worth in the market. The reason that she had such poor production is the loss of her husband due to illness. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic is offering through Kiva, giving her the opportunity to have a loan in order to continue with her agricultural life and keep moving forward after all that has happened.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; la socia tiene 28 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 2 hijos y ella se dedica a la administración y atención de su tienda de abarrotes y depósito de cervezas, la socia trabaja con su conyugue él es ganadero y siempre que puede la apoya; La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad; la socia desea comprar arroz, fideos, aceites, leche harina. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 28, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She runs her grocery and beer warehouse.  She works with her spouse who raises livestock and helps her out whenever he’s able.  She wants to use the loan to buy some basic need items.  She wants to buy rice, noodles, oil, milk and flour.  She is requesting the loan to buy basic need items.

She is satisfied with and grateful for the support she’s gotten through this means and commits to repay her debt in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Estrudez

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ertrudes. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tiene un hijo de 17 años, el cual está  estudiando el primer semestre  en la  Universidad Técnica de Manabí. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se es una muy buena ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas como: gaseosas, aguas, enegizantes, cervezas y batidos de frutas, también prepara y vende empanadas, hamburguesas, entre otros bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que lleva 16 años dedicada a su negocio y que le va muy bien y además se entretiene  en el.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, aguas, cervezas, pan, carne y otros ingredientes. Es socia del Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio hace varios años y le gusta porque se entretiene con sus compañeras en las reuniones y por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) communal bank meets every two weeks in 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí Province known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, the variety of its fauna and for its kind, hard working residents who are farmers and raise livestock.

We met Ertrudes, 56, here.  She’s married and has a 17-year-old son who is in his first semester at Manabí Technical University.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who, in order to have her own income, is a merchant.  She has a small snack bar where she sells such beverages as: soft drinks, water, energizing drinks, beer, fruit smoothies.  She also makes and sells turnovers and hamburgers, among other fast food snacks.  She works every day from 8am until 7pm and she tells us that she’s been in this business for 16 years and does very well.  Besides, she has fun with it.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, beer, bread, meat and other ingredients.  

She’s been a member of the communal bank since the beginning several years ago and she likes it because she has fun with her fellow members at the meetings and because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is that her son becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, energy drinks, water, beer, bread, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rina Mirian

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Rina y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 49 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la crianza de pollos y cuyes”. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities are producing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.

In the town of Quillabamba we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet Rina who tells us:

"I was born in the town of Quillabamba and I am 49 years old.  I live in the town in which I was born and my main business activity is raising chickens and guinea pigs".

On this occasion, Rina needs a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lidia quien tiene una tortillería y vende chiverías desde hace desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo inicio con un quintal de maíz medio flete de leña (la mitad de una carreta de leña) y un comal; ahora ella utiliza cuatro quintales.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana   quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 años y Vilma  de 52 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (Together) group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women from Masaya.  The group coordinator is Lidia who has a tortilla shop and she’s also been selling snacks for the last 7 years.  She started the business with just a quintal of corn, half a wagonload of firewood and one griddle.  Now, she consumes four quintals.

The other group members are Juana who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last two years and Vilma, 52, who butchers pigs and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, powdered lime, etc.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elvis; el socio tiene 31 años; el socio es conviviente; El socio tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la crianza de ganados vacunos y toros, el socio compra ganados tiernos los cría, engorda, los hace reproducir, y los vende; el socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de vacas tiernas, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 2 vacas tiernas para incrementar sus ventas y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Elvis is 31 years old and lives with his partner.  He has two children and his business is raising cattle and bulls.  He buys calves, raises them, fattens them, breeds them and then sells them.  He would like to invest this loan in buying two calves in order to increase his sales and provide his children with a better quality of life.

Elvis is very happy and grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Elisabeth y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 30 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la venta de productos de belleza”. Ella va ser mama por primera vez  y tiene 9 meses de embarazo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos.
texts.en:
(Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención Province and an important commercial hub of the Lares and La Convención Valleys.  The main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

We visited the “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” (Brave Hearts of San Juan Moor) in the city of Quillabamba and met its member, Elisabeth, there.  She tells us:

“I was born in the city of Quillabamba.  I’m 30 years old and live in the same city where I was born.  My main activity is selling beauty products.” 

She is going to be a mother for the first time; she is nine months pregnant.  

On this opportunity she needs the loan to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Dellanira Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dellaneira, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y una de 17 años, sus dos últimas hijas aun viven con nuestra amiga y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga al ver que lo que  su esposo llevaba al hogar no alcanzaba para los gastos tanto del hogar como de los estudios de sus hijas hace dos años atrás emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa interior y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y sus hijas le ayudan vendiendo a sus compañeras de clases, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lo que más venden son los perfumes y los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva  en el Grupo de Crédito 8 años y nos dice que el grupo es como su familia en la que está muy contenta por la ayuda que le han dado. 

Sus sueños son ver que sus hijas sean profesionales y que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Madres para un Futuro Mejor' (Mothers for a Better Future) community bank meet in 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  This area is known for its beautiful landscape, its woods, its wide variety of fauna and for its kind and hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 45 year-old Dellaneira who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are already grown up and her youngest [daughter] is 17 years old.  Our friend's two youngest daughters still live with her and are studying at university.  Her husband is a builder.

Seeing that the money her husband was bringing home wasn't enough to cover their household expenses and their daughters' education expenses, our friend decided two years ago to start her own business selling underwear and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and her daughters help by selling products to their classmates.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that what she sells the most of are perfumes and cosmetics.

Dellaneira will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.  She has been a member of her community bank for eight years and she tells us that the group are like her family and that she is very happy for the help they have given her.

Dellaneira's dream is to see her daughters become professionals and enjoy a good future.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Vilma y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 54 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la agricultura”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de sus cultivos y desea comprar abono e insecticidas. 

(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
texts.en:
We visited the “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” (Brave Hearts of San Juan Moor) communal bank in the city of Quillabamba and met its member, Vilma, there.  She relates:

“I was born in the city of Quillabamba.  I’m 54 years old and live in the same city where I was born.  My main activity is agriculture.” 

On this occasion she needs the loan to care for her crops and wants to buy manure and insecticide.

(Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención Province and an important commercial hub of the Lares and La Convención valleys.   Its main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Davila Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Dávila está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Meyling Francisca quien se dedica al comercio de frutas al inicio hace ocho años aproximadamente empezó comprando los productos por libras en la actualidad compra las cosechas de tamarindo, mango, jocote y mamón...etc.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años y una bebe de ocho meses por los cuales labora arduamente junto a su esposo y suegro. Ella ahora comprará limón y aguacate. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Modesta Francisca de 19 años, Milagro de Jesús  de 37 años y Alba de 30 años quien se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras de acuerdo a la temporada.
texts.en:
The “Dávila” group is composed of four hard working, enterprising people.  The coordinator is Meyling Francisca who is a fruit merchant.  When she started out about eight years ago she started buying fruit by the pound.  Now, she buys entire crops of tamarind, mangoes, jocote (common names include Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, Sineguela, and Siriguela), mamón (Spanish lime), etc.

She has three children, a ten-year-old, a five-year-old and an 8-month-old baby, that she works very hard for together with her husband and father-in-law.  On this occasion she’ll buy lemons and avocadoes.

The other group members are Modesta Francisca, 19, Milagro de Jesús, 37, and Alba, 30, who are merchants selling seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy lemon and avocado crops.

loans.name: Mery Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; la socia tiene 39 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 5 hijos y ella se dedica a  trabajar en  una empresa de televisión en el area de personal de limpieza, la socia trabaj desde hace 5 años; la socia ahora desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de viveres para el hogar, pago de estudios de sus hios en el colegio y la socia ira pagando poco a poco con su sueldo las cuotas. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de víveres y pagos de los estudios de colegio de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Mery is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has five children.  She works as a cleaner at a television company.  She has been working there for five years.  She would like this loan to invest in buying provisions supplies for her home.  She will also pay her children's school expenses.  She will make her loan repayments gradually with her salary.

Mery is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy household products and to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Fernando has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, snacks & rice per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

Fernando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells liquid petroleum gas & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stocks of liquid petroleum gas.

Luz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of liquid petroleum gas

loans.name: Chilo

texts.en:
Chilo is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Chilo has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Chilo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Chilo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jakelin Roxana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Jakelin y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 24 años edad y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y tengo varias actividad como por ejemplo, estudio la carreta profesional de Derecho de 2 de la tarde hasta las 6 de la noche, trabajo en el ministerio de agricultura de Quillabamba desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 1 del tarde y regreso a las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche y también vendo ropa por catálogos”. 

Jakelin es técnico en contabilidad y es una joven profesional que es trabajadora y responsable que busca las mejores oportunidades para tener una mejor calidad de vida. En esta oportunidad Jakelin requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería. 

(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
texts.en:
In the town of Quillabamba we visit the “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet Jakelin who tells us:

"I was born in the town of Quillabamba.  I am 24 years old and live in the town where I was born.  I am engaged in a number of different activities.  For example, I am studying for a law degree and attend classes from 2.00pm to 6.00pm.  I work in the Ministry of Agriculture in Quillabamba from 7.00am to 1.00pm and return home from 6.00pm to 10.00pm.  I also sell clothes through catalogs".

Jakelin is an accounting clerk and a young professional who is hard working and responsible.  She is looking for better opportunities so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.  On this occasion, Jakelin needs a loan to buy merchandise.

Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities are growing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña María tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es técnico en telefonía, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. María hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, pero hace 6 meses esta criando pollos y cuyes, es un proyecto en el cual están recibiendo charlas de profesionales para ponerle en práctica y se encuentran involucradas gran parte de sus amigas y esperan salir en adelante.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo ciclo y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para un galpón de pollos y pollos.
 
Su meta es crecer y sacar adelante al proyecto trazado.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Maluay” communal Bank and lives in the community of the same name in Del Valle parish. This parish has beautiful landscapes to admire. It's people are dedicated to commerce, animal raising, and agriculture. Many go to the city daily to work in different areas. The people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maria is 34 years old, married, and from this union there are 2 children, ages 15 and 8 respectively. Her older daughter is studying in high school and her son attends a small school in the city. Maria's husband is a telephone technician. The house they live in is their own property, resulting from their collective efforts.

For some 10 years, Maria has been selling cosmetics, trade name Yanbal.  Also, for the last 6 months, she has been raising chickens and guinea pigs. Maria is attending lectures by professionals in this project, and putting the lessons in practice, alongside many of her friends, who hope to get ahead in this manner.

Maria's communal bank is in its 7th loan cycle and her new loan will be invested in purchasing construction materials to build a shed for her chickens and guinea pigs.

Maria's goal is to grow and forge ahead in her planned project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a shed for raising chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Evelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, junk foods & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Rosa Sarbelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 13 y 11 años de edad, quienes estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, construida en unión conyugal.

Doña Rosa labora en la venta de frutas, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, sus productos los vende recorriendo en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos que es para su consumo y para la venta.
 
Este es su séptimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para comprar frutas para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un vehículo para trasladarse.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the Maluay community bank.  She lives in the community that bears the same name, and which is part of Valle parish.  This parish has beautiful landscapes to admire, and its people are engaged in commerce, livestock and agriculture.  Many leave daily for the city to work in different areas, and the people maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Rosa is 33 years old.  She is married and the fruit of their conjugal union are the 2 daughters they conceived, who are 13 and 11 years of old.  They attend a small school in the city.  Her husband sells Herbalife products, and the house where they live is their property, constructed during their marriage.

Doña Rosa works selling fruits; she has been doing this activity for 20 years.  Her products are sold by travelling to a market in the city.  She works Sunday to Sunday from 8 am to 4 pm.  At home, she works raising chickens for their own consumption and for sale.

This is her seventh loan through the community bank, and she will invest it to buy fruit for her business.

Her dream is to have a vehicle to get about in.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Delia Esther

texts.es:
La Señora. Delia es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Delia tiene de 54 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 26, 19, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su hija de 17 años es casada e independiente y su última hija este año ingresa al colegio. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad, siendo el sacrifico de años de trabajo.

La Señora Delia labora como empleada domestica, trabaja 3 días a la semana de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos y gallinas las que vende en su propia comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un becerro. 

Su meta es llegar a tener muchos animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Maluay communal bank.  She lives in Maluay that belongs to El Valle Parish, a parish with beautiful scenery to admire.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and are farmers.  Many go out daily to work at various jobs in the city.  Its people keep their culture and traditions alive.

Delia is 54 years old and lives in a common law relationship.  She has five children who are 26, 19, 17, 14 and 12 years of age.  Three of her children work and help her out economically.  Her 17-year-old daughter is married and her youngest will start secondary school this year.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession.  The house they live in is their property it being the result of many years of work and sacrifice.

Delia works as a domestic employee three days a week from 8am until 5pm.  At home she raises pigs and chickens that she then sells in her community.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she’ll use the new loan to buy a calf.  Her goal is to have lots of animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Flordelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & cooked snack dishes like rice cakes. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook snacks to sell.

Flordelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Flordelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking snacks to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 58 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Bernadette has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 9,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

Bernadette has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Bernadette hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ruth has a pigpen that sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ruth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn, 32, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a retail shop where she sells fish-like sardines and milkfish. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Carolyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Carolyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita, 56, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a retail shop selling charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconut shells for charcoal-making.

Purita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Purita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal-making.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 56, is married with four children and lives in the Philippines. Gloria grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. 

Gloria has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizer for her vegetable planting. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her vegetable planting

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is married and lives in Cambodia. She lives a simple, honorable, working life and, with her husband's support, she runs a laundry to provide for her family. Her business is successful and she has good relationships with her community neighbors and is able to earn an increasing daily profit.

So is requesting a loan of 500 USD to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 50, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. Irma has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Irma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Irma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, 31, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. He is a provider of motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. Eric has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for utilities.

Eric is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities.

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Ms. Math is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh with her relatives.   She has been selling clothes in the market for several years, but recently started a business in which she sells shoes.  In this business she can earn about $10 per day.  She would like to request a loan to purchase additional shoes for sale.  With her additional income, she will help to support the daily needs of her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase additional new shoes for sales.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 42, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and detergents. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 51, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She has a retail shop that sells fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for three years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Avelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 22, is married with one child and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living, which she has been doing for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. Norma has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 55, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She has a retail shop that sells fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for two years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 49, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with six children. She has a retail shop selling fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Lourdes is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong lives in the Baray district of Kompong Thom.  She is 49 years old and though she was once married, she divorced her husband several years ago. She has seven children, three of whom are single and live with her, while four others live separately.  She and the three single children work many jobs and pool their incomes to cover the family’s expenses. Mrs. Kong would like to request a loan to purchase a cow to grow for slaughter to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for feeding.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rhodora has a construction shop that sells cement & hollow blocks. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making hollow blocks.

Rhodora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making hollow blocks

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles & detergents.

Emee is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & detergents

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Concepcion has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & candies.

Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & candies

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Julie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and coconut wine. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and breads.

Julie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and breads

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Editha has a food shop that sells snacks like shakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar, like a sugared doughnut twist). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Editha is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Jessie has a karaoke services that provides entertainment to customers. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities for the karaoke services.

Jessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities for the karaoke services

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From Kompong Chhang Province of Cambodia, Mrs. Eng, age 41, is an old mother of three children. Presently, she is a pig raiser and grocery seller in front of her house. She can earn average of $5 per day. Her husband is 43 years old. His occupation is a domestic farmer. Taking time for doing farming business, he works at catching fish in and around the pond and river, and is earning a profit of $3 per day. Mrs. Eng would like to requests some fund from Kiva loan in order to purchase pig feed and with the rest of the funds she will buy some mixed product (grocery).

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and buy some mix grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Chandara

texts.en:
