Chandara, 44 year old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $2 per day. She has five children: one is studying and the other four are working with $11 per day earned by all.

Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 school fees, and $30 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to feed for selling so that she can make more income for supporting her family. Her family has been doing this since they married until now, and the income is only for supporting the family (they never have any money left). That’s why she wants to raise pigs to sell for more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs for selling

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 12 children.
Josefina has a shop that sells breads, canned goods and snacks. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and breads. Josefina has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and breads.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is married with five children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Apolonia is a farmer who grows crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 10,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers for raising her crops. Apolonia has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for raising crops.

loans.name: Raffy

texts.en:
Raffy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
Raffy provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for service utilities. Raffy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2003. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for service utilites.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Net is a 45-year-old farmer. Her husband is a security guard and their income is $4 per day. Net has five children, two of whom are studying while the other three are working in a factory for $3 per day each. Every month, Net has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $25 on school fees, and $21 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy stuff for using in the house. She has a strong commitment to send her children to study at university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy stuff for using in the house.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 32 years old and works in a factory for $3.5 per day. She is a single mother with one child, who is 11 years old. Sophal lives with her sister and child. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy some farmland for farming during the rainy season. In the future, she wants to sell cosmetics to her friends at the factory, so that she can earn more income to support her son's studies.

loans.use: to buy farmland for farming.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon, a 36-year-old married father of two, lives in the Philippines where he has been providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Marion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the service's utilities. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the service's utilities

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von is now 30 years old, living in Siem Reap province. She has four children who are dependent on her.   She is not only a good housewife but also a good business woman. Currently, she sells dirt, earning three dollar per day net profit and her husband drives a small motor boat.  They work very hard to earn more income to support their life.  They would like to start a new business transporting goods because they see market opportunity in Siem Reap.  However they do not have enough money to purchase a truck. They would like to borrow money from Kiva to purchase a used truck. With this loan and a new car, they can earn more profit.  With their profit from their new business, they would like to improve and widen their house. They also want their children to become well educated people.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Eleonor, a 26-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she raises and sells pigs, an enterprise she has operated for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. In the future, Eleonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren, a 49-year-old resident of the Philippines, is separated and has one child. For five years Efren has had a shop that sells vegetables and bananas. A new member of HSPFI, he has requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy bananas and vegetables to sell. In the future, Efren hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Him is a 56 year-old widow woman and she is a good mother of four children, two of them are single and living under her care while the rest two are ready married and start to live in their own houses. She also relies on one of her kids who works at overseas as a worker. To earn living, Mrs. Him runs a small business by selling some fresh fish in the busy market next to her house. From this, she can be able to make an income approximately $5 each day for her family expenses.  Mrs. Him will be using a loan which she is requesting to purchase more fish to go on selling so she can increase her daily revenue by using Kiva loan. With the rest, she hopes to use for repairing her broken house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to go on selling and to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en: Sotera, a 67-year-old married mother of 10, lives in the Philippines where she has owned and operated a retail shop selling sliced fruits such as mangoes and guavas for five years. A new member of HSPFI, Sotera has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene, 40-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Ozamis City where she has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 3000 each month.  Marlene, who became a member of PMPC just this year, has  requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Nora has a retail shop that sells canned good, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Nora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Sukun

texts.en:
Sukun, 41 years old, is working in garment factory. Her income is $3 per day. She is a single mother with six children. Two are studying and the other four are working in the factory with $3 per day for each. 

Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $30 on rent and $30 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $550 for medical treatment for her old mother. 

In the future, she wants to buy grocery goods to sell at home instead of working in the factory so that she can take care her mother and her children also.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her old mother.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Lanie has a food shop that sells homemade ice cream in different flavors. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

Lanie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 53 years old, sells gruel. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. She has five children. Three are studying and two are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $7 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fish, meat and vegetables to sell in her village. She has not sold those things before, but she wants to start selling them to make more income. Her current career can make only a small income, so she wants to get two careers to support each other. 

And if the new career can work well, she will stop selling gruel and extend her second career instead.

loans.use: To buy fish, meat and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has three children. 

Rocel has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, shoes, sandals and blouses. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Rocel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en: Sothy is 53 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom work in a factory making $5 per day each. Sothy sells fish paste with her husband and makes an income of $8 per day. Every month, she spends $117 on expenses. Sothy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more fish paste to sell. She has been in this business since 2007 and has a lot of customers. With her income, she would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fish paste to sell.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin, 52, and her husband, 47, are living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Both of them planting crops to support their family. Through this business, they gain profit of about $5 per day. Living with each other for a long time, they have birthed six kids and have made a happy family. To help with the expenses of a big family, some of the children try to find good jobs. In order to support her family business, Mrs. Sin needs to request a loan amount of $800. She will use the funds to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en: Seyha is 26 years old and is a motorbike repairman. Seyha has one two-year old son with his wife, who sells pigs to make a living. The couple's combined income is $10 per day. Every month, Seyha spends $70 on food, $9 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy motorbike parts. Seyha started working as a motorbike repairman after he got married and he only had a small amount of money to start the business. Now that his career is going well, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motorbike parts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Alma has a retail shop that sells fish, such as sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. Alma has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business. Alma is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 48 years old, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. Helen has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, spices and vegetables. She has had this business for 20 years. Helen has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices and food seasonings to sell. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business. Helen is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy spices and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 42 years old, is married with four children and lives in the Philippines. Arlene has a retail shop that sells candies, breads and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. Arlene has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business. Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Leah

texts.en:
Ana Leah is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Ana Leah has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ana Leah is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: In Cambodia, there are many kinds of jobs to choose. For the happiness of a small family, Sen and her husband always try to do the work that gains lots of cash daily. Sen does a business as a fish seller in one market near her village. Her husband doesn’t stay at home, he also gains income for their family. Both earn suitable profit, perhaps $10 per day. One of their two children is working as a diamond polisher. To improve their life, Mrs.Sen wishes to ask for a loan in the amount of $700 to open a small business as a motorbike repairer.

loans.use: to open a small business as a motorbike repairer.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Anabel has a retail shop that sells fruits like mangoes and apples. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell.

Anabel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nouen

texts.en:
Nouen, 56 years old, is a basket maker. She has been selling baskets for about five years now, and she can make good income to support the family, but now she is getting old and she wants to buy grocery goods to sell at her house instead of making baskets to sell.
 
Her husband is a security guard. Their income is $3 per day. 

She has three children. Two are studying. 

Every month she has to spend around $80 for all the expenses of the family. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her children to use when traveling to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use for traveling to work.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has four children.
 
Ma. Arlene  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads and snacks. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ma. Arlene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jonabeth

texts.en:
Jonabeth is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Jonabeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for a year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Jonabeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom is the big head of a family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For improving his financial status, he works driving a motorbike in this province everyday. He can earn about $3 per day to give to his wife. His wife isn't lazy, she works raising animals like ducks, chickens and pigs. They have birthed five kids; a big family, very happy. To assist their efforts, Mr. Prom wishes to borrow some funds to sponsor his family, about $1,000, in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Deverly

texts.en:
At 23, Deverly is very determined to be successful. She is single and is engaged in a retail business which is situated in front of her house. She offers shampoo, soap, bread and snacks in the community.

Deverly is requesting a loan of Php15,000 to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food. Deverly plans to save money for her future and also to support her mother and father in their daily needs.

In the future, Deverly hopes to expand her business by offering more products.

loans.use: to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
At the age of 53, Rodrigo has worked for over 30 years in farming in order to meet his family's needs. He is married and is a responsible father to his four children. He is doing the best in farming to improve his crop production.  He wants to give his children an education.

Rodrigo is asking for a loan to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizers from animal manure, rice seeds and herbicides. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the service of the laborers he hired for his land preparation.

In the future, Rodrigo hopes to increase his business for his family to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy farming products like organic fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Heu

texts.en: With the responsibility as of head of his family, Heu always thinks about the strategy to gain more money for his family. Now, 48 years old, he is living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who has lots of experience with this business. Due to talent and being clever, Heu also takes time to do another business of driving a motorbike so that he can earn suitable money to give to his wife everyday. He and his wife have given birth to two kids. This, they feel, shows prosperity in family, as richness is family. Heu wishes to borrow some funds in the amount of $1,100 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Chomrouen

texts.en:
Chomrouen, 57 year old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife sells food and vegetables. Their income is $10 per day. He has two children.  One is a construction worker and one sells vegetables.  Their income is $5 per day for each.  Every month, Chomrouen has to spend $120 on food, $5 on electriciT., and $40 on other expenses. 

He would like a loan of $500 to buy a store for his wife to sell vegetables. His wife has sold vegetables since they married, and she can make a good income from it.

loans.use: To buy a store for selling vegetables

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov is a nail decorator. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $8 per day. She has one child who is one year old.  Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy little fishes to raise and sell. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for a long time (since before they were married).  He has always wanted to change to another career but he didn’t know what a good career would be for him. He had talked to his wife, and they found that feeding fishes is one good career that he can do.  He hopes he can make a good income from his new career.

loans.use: To buy young fish for fish farming

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is a cake-seller and her husband is an artist. The couple has three children, all of whom are working in a beautician shop. The couple earns 8 USD daily and, together, their children earn 4 USD a day. Each month, Hay and her family spend 100 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 5 USD on rent and 10 USD on other expenses.

Hay is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy ingredients and equipment to start a business making and selling food. She has been planning to open this business for a long time, but has not been able to save enough money to start. This loan will enable her to start her new food-selling business and Hay hopes to earn more income than she currently does selling cake.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment to start a food-selling business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim, 43, is living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a Khmer musician, playing traditional music of Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sim takes time to work as a fish seller in one market near her village. Together, this couple earns a profit of about $5 per day. They have five kids in their care. Now one of the five is working in Phnom Penh, getting a suitable salary per month. To improve the happiness of their big family, Mrs.Sim would like to request a loan in the amount of $ 600 in order to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, she will send all of her children to study at high levels, as others.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдурахим имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он повар. У него имеется столовая рядом с Автобазой, где он работает поваром. В этой области он работает уже 28 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой и приобретения продуктов.
texts.en: Abdurahim lives in Vahdat.  He is 55 years old, married, and has seven children.  His wife is a housewife.  Abdurahim has a vocational education as a cook.  He has a cafe near the bus station where he works as a cook.  He has been doing this for 28 years.  He is taking out a loan to renovate his cafe and buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: to renovate his cafe and buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurm is a fish seller in a market near her village, earning about $3 per day, while her husband catches fish from ponds, lakes and rivers. Soeurm is a mother of five, one of whom works in local construction, earning a good monthly salary. Now requesting a loan of $300, Soeurn wishes to purchase fishing materials.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Chhav

texts.en: Mr. Chhav resides of Siem Reap Province with his wife and children.  To make a daily income, he and his wife are working together planting rice crops and a few fruit tree. This family normally earns an average of $3.60 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. To improve his family’s standard of living, Mr. Chhav is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow new crops and help his existing crops grow better.  In the future, Mr. Chhav hopes he can support his children to attain a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops growing well.

loans.name: Jumabubu's Group

texts.en:
Jumabubu, 50, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kant, a small town near Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).  She and her husband have raised three daughters. The oldest daughter works in a sewing workshop, the second in a café, and the youngest daughter studies at school.

Five years ago Jumabubu got a loan of 30,000 soms.  She spent it on purchasing cattle.  Since then she has been breeding cattle and reselling it after fattening.  In this way she earns 15,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to improve her living conditions and repay that loan successfully.  At the moment, Jumabubu needs additional funds to increase the number of cattle. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. In the future, Jumabubu wants to see all her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is 44 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married, with 2 children.  Angelo works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 13 years. He requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Angelo has been a member of PMPC for over 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru: Худойкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии Худойкул работает уже 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khudoykul lives in Shahrituz.  He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is a housewife, and his son works in the Russian Federation.  He has a higher education as an economist. Khudoykul has worked in his profession for ten years.  Additionally, he farms.  In front of his home he has a plot of land where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  He's been doing this for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and lives in Delapaz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 6 children.  Juana works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell. Juana has become a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Juana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 22, 21 and 20.  Charito and her husband are both farmers. Charito helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and helps in weeding the farm. Charito also runs sari-sari store, where she sells bread, oil and fruits.

Charito requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizer and other items to sell.  Charito hopes to have better earnings so she can help improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizer and more items to sell

loans.name: Josepina

texts.en:
Josepina is married, with 9 children. Josefina is 59 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.  Josepina sells food for snacks to earn a living. This is a new business.

She has requested a loan of PHP3000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.  Josepina has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Josepina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 59 years old and is a married woman with one child. She has been engaged in farming for 16 years. She helps her husband till the land where they grow rice and corn crops. Edita also runs a sari-sari store business. She sells dry goods and vegetables.

Edita requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, like canned goods. She hopes to have a bigger farm and store someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, like canned goods

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 37 years old, married and has nine children. For the past sixteen years she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines, working hard to provide for her family. She also earns an income from buying and selling tobacco.

Jenifer has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as noodles, canned goods and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jenifer has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 37-year-old lady, married to Bernadus. They have been blessed with two lovely children, namely: Irma, a 14 year old girl, in the 2nd grade of junior high school and Doni, a 9 year old boy, in the 4th grade of elementary school.

Yuliana sells betel vine and areca nuts (a kind of plant and fruit that can be chewed both dried and fresh with lime) in the market. Yuliana has been engaged this business for five years since they returned from Irian Jaya – another province in Indonesia. She is interested in running the business as there are many people, particularly those who come from the remote places that still consume betel vine and areca nuts. The betel vine and areca nuts also still become one of the requirements in wedding tradition when the groom proposes the bride. 

Yuliana initiated the business using her money. She decided to run the business as she wants to help her husband in generating more income. Moreover, their children are growing up so Yuliana needs more money to cover their living and educational cost as well. Yuliana is a kind-hearted mother; she is willing to work hard for her children’s future. She hopes that they will have better life than she has now. Yuliana would like to expand her business by selling garlic and onion. She is optimistic that these products will be sold out quickly as they are the main ingredients in cooking. Therefore, Yuliana is seeking a loan that can help her in improving her business.

She heard information about TLM that it usually assists the small entrepreneurs who have the passion and willingness to improve their businesses. She is  requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase garlic and onion in large quantity and to add more betel vine and areca nuts stocks.

loans.use: to purchase garlic and onion in large quantity and to add more betel vine and areca nuts stocks

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, 37, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with four children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and snacks, a business she has had for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Felicitas is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Ium

texts.en:
Ium and her husband have five children and since 1979 have been happily living in Prey Chor, a district in Kampong Cham Province.

Ium is a farmer as well as a cake seller. She would like to request a loan from HKL of $150 in order to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. In the future she hopes to expand her farm and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, 42, is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell. Emelia also opened a sari sari store to help in her family's daily needs.

Emelia has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of seeds and two sacks of fertilizer. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of seeds and two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, 25, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for three years. Elvie has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Elvie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Kitale town in western Kenya. He has a family with four children between nine and 14 years old. For the past eight years, Daniel has been a farmer, producing eggs, vegetables, and tomatoes to sell at the local market. His business helps to provide food and education for his children.

Daniel is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds for his poultry business.  His greatest business challenge is poultry diseases. Daniel is glad Juhudi is providing small farmers with loans. In the future, Daniel hopes to generate more income to be able to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel, 29, is married with three children, aged 9, 7 and 5. Her husband works as a farmer and an electrician.

Hazel is engaged in farming and helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. She helps grow rice crops and to keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She also runs a sari sari store where she sells items such as oil, vinegar and sugar. Hazel has been running the store for two years.

Hazel has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, two quarts of herbicide and three sacks of seeds. She hopes this loan will help to improve their harvest. Hazel also hopes for her family to always be healthy.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, two quarts of herbicide and three sacks of seeds.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a single, hard-working farmer, a job he has done for five years. He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicide for his farm. He feels that the loan will be of great help in growing his crops and is looking forward to the possibilities.

Felipe earned 38,000 PHP of income in his last harvest last April, which was used as budget for his family's basic needs and supporting his sister's education. Being the bread winner of his family, Felipe desires to get higher income from his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Svay's Group

texts.en:
Svay is a 28-year-old a domestic worker who transports fish to the market. She was elected to be the team leader for this group of four people, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province. Svay is a married woman blessed with three children, all of whom are still young and living under her care. Her husband is a porter in his village. Because of uncomfortable living conditions, Svay is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to decorate her old house.

These are three other borrowers:

Sok is a porter as well as a fisherman who is seeking a loan to buy new fishing nets; Hok, a local porter, is requesting a Kiva loan to repair his house;. Choun, a motor driver, is also requesting a loan to repair his house.

loans.use: to decorate her old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: To have a good life, one must try. Mrs. Kong, 25, and her husband, just 27, both have jobs. Mrs. Kong is a fish and cheese seller in Baray district, Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Her husband doesn’t waste time, he works as a retail and wholesale seller of fish to more clients. Both of them are young, but they care for two children responsibly. For improving on her business, Mrs. Kong wishes to borrow a loan in the amount of $800 in order to purchase more fish to sell, in time, to customers. She is shown in the photo with her baby.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell, in time, to customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 52, is married with two children, aged 25 and 23. She is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Her husband mainly manages their farm and she helps him grow rice and corn crops. Helen also sells dried fish to the people in her community.

Helen works hard to support her family. She has applied for a loan to fund their farm. She plans to purchase three sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizer and three quarts of herbicide. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizer and three quarts of herbicide.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a shop that sells snacks, biscuits and beverages, a business she has had for four years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta de 29 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son dependientes, Violeta  vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope,  ella cuenta con casa propia que solo tiene servicio de agua, su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad a la que se dedica Violeta es la crianza y comercialización  de animales menores y aves de corral como patos y gallinas, la crianza de estos  animales la realiza desde hace 4 años, en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su casa, ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el negocio rubro, además cuenta con clientela fija para su negocio.

Violeta está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual será para invertir en compra de aves menores con sus respectivo alimento balanceado y pastos naturales. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización, por eso violeta seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Violeta es una mujer  responsable y  trabajadora que desea poder ayudar a su esposo y de esta manera logar que su familia alcance una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Violeta, age 29, is married and has two children who are still dependent. Violeta lives in a rural zone of the Morrope district. She has her own home which only has running water. Her community is small and has approximately 200 families.

Violeta raises and sells small animals and barnyard birds such as ducks and hens. She has raised these animals for four years in corrals located in the back of her home. She learned this work from her parents, which means that she has a thorough knowledge of this business. She has a fixed customer base.

Violeta is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will be invested in the purchase of barnyard birds, and balanced feed and natural grass for these animals. This business has competition, but it also has a large market. For this reason Violeta wants to continue expanding her business.

Violeta is a responsible and hard-working woman who wants to be able to help her husband and thus ensure that her family achieves a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals, with balanced feed for said animals, for sale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MatilD. tiene 54 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 están en el colegio, MatilD. cuenta con vivienda propia la misma que esta ubicada en un caserío llamado la Matanza en el distrito D. Morropón, al norte del país en el departamento D. Piura, su comunidad por ser rural aun no cuenta con todos loa servicios básicos.

MatilD. se dedica desD. hace más D. 8 años a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno. Ella los cría en amplios corrales y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito. Adicionalmente ella tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. frutas el cual realiza los fines D. semana. Con estos ingresos  que el obtiene D. estas actividades se encarga D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea comprar animales para engorD. y alimentarlos con productos balanceados y  poder así mejorar el desarrollo D. sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio, además desea ampliar sus negocio D. frutas.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2500 nuevos soles.

MatilD. es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 54, married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. MatilD. has her own home located in a hamlet called La Matanza in the district of Morropon, in the north of the country in the department of Piura. Because her community is rural, they still do not have all of the basic services.

MatilD. has bought and sold cattle for over 8 years. She raises them in large corrals, and when they have reached a good level of development she sells them to the local businesspeople and to her neighbours and the local residents. She also has a small business selling fruits on the weekends. With the income from these businesses she takes charge of getting her family ahead.

She wants to buy animals for fattening, and feed them balanced products in order to improve their development and sell them at a better price. She also wants to expand her fruit business. For this reason she has decided to request a loan of 2500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

MatilD. is a hard-working, active and very responsible person. Those who know her say she is calm and trustworthy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle with balanced food for better development.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok has been living in Kompong Speu Province. Mr. Sok is a 24-year-old married man without a baby, as he has been married only for a few years. To make his living, he has been employed as a local garment factory worker at the manufacturer in Phnom Penh City. He always receives a proper salary per month. He also has additional income, which is generated from his wife, who is a local farmer. 

The family can get around $4.32 profit each day. This amount supports the whole family with their other expenses. To reduce to the traveling costs, Mr. Sok would like to request some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorbike to drive to his working place. With these loan funds, he will not pay for a motor taxi any more when he needs to go to achieve his routine duty and to go anywhere.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, 43, is married with four school-aged children. His wife served as a health worker in their village. He has been engaged in growing rice for 21 years. Farming is the primary source of income that his family relies on. 

He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of rice fields. Someday, Felipe dreams that his children will finish their education and eventually be employed with stable jobs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of rice fields.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, 56, is married with three adult children. She lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family.

Jean is a farmer and assists her husband in maintaining their rice farm. She helps plant rice crops and in weeding the farm. Two years ago, Jean decided to run a barbecue business. She makes chicken and pork barbecue and sells it to the people in her community. Jean does her best to increase her family income.

Jean has asked for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies. In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, 44, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a pigpen where she sells mature, grown pigs. She has had this business for ten years. Marife has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive con su pareja, con el que tiene 02 hijos, reside en casa propia y vive en el distrito de Tambogrande. en el departamento de Piura al norte del Perú, ella por vivir en una zona urbana cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y energía eléctrica.

Giovana cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta actualmente con clientela fija y fidelizada.  Además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo los cuales vende en su casa y recorriendo caseríos cercanos y gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido apoyar  a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo

Giovana  esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para que ella pueda compra mercadería para surtir su bodega y comprar más productos de belleza para que cuente con mercadería necesaria en su domicilio, ella piensa que esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Giovana es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Giovana is 34 and lives with her partner, with whom she has two children. She lives in her own home in the Tambogrande district in the Piura department in the north of Peru. Because she lives in an urban zone, she has basic water and electricity services.

Giovana has a store in her home. There she sells various daily use products, such as basic staples and groceries, to her neighbours. She has a fixed and loyal customer base. She also sells beauty products from a catalogue, which she sells in her home and by traveling to various nearby hamlets. Thanks to these businesses, she has been able to support her husband in maintaining their family and getting ahead.

Giovana is requesting a loan of 2200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can purchase merchandise to stock her store and purchase more beauty products so that she will have the necessary merchandise in her home. She thinks that this is an investment that will allow her to continue expanding her business.

Giovana is a very diligent and hard-working person. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (basic staples) and beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Khvay

texts.en: Baray district, Kompong Province, Cambodia, has many kinds of jobs available. Mrs. Kvay is the old mother of four kids. She is a fish seller and raises pigs at home. With respect to her husband, he is the main the person in her family. He doesn’t depend on the farm, but also takes time to catch fish by the pound, in the lake and river. To support a big family and to be as comfortable as others, two of their four kids have gone to find suitable jobs in Phnom Penh. They earn specific salaries to bring to their parents. For improving her family to good living standards, Mrs.Kong wishes a loan in the amount of $125 in order to purchase fishing materials.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad vive con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos menores, cuenta con casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en un caserío llamado Capilla Santa Rosa, en el departamento de Lambayeque a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en sus comunidad no cuentan con los servicios básicos , por ser zona rural. 

José se dedica  a la comercialización de animales desde hace varios años. El cría animales, especialmente ganado ovino, ganado vacuno, cerdos y cabritos, a campo abierto cerca de su domicilio El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

José El desea adquirir más animales pues se propuesto incrementar su nivel de crianza y por consiguiente necesita alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario ganadero para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 50 and lives with his wife. They have 2 young children. They have their own home in a hamlet called Capilla Santa Rosa, in the Lambayeque department one hour from the city of Chiclayo. In their community, they do not have any basic services, because it is a rural area.

Jose has sold animals for several years. He raises animals, especially ovine and bovine animals, and swine, in an open field near his home. He feeds them grains and natural grass. When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the businesspeople who frequently visit his neighbourhood.

Jose wants to acquire more animals to increase the amount that he is raising. Thus he needs balanced feed to expand his business. He has therefore decided to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

Jose is a very diligent and hard-working person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a livestock businessman in order to be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire more animals and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hard and soft beverages such as sodas and beers to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene  44  años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, cuenta con casa propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío, en el distrito de Morropón, departamento de Piura,

Sabastiana se dedica a la venta de cerveza  y harina molida para la preparación de  chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú, preparada en base a maíz y harina), ella cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años en este negocio, y a adquirido experiencia y clientela fija para sus negocio.

Sabastiana esta solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda ampliar sus negocio, comprando más cerveza y maíz en grandes cantidades, para procesarlo y convertirlo en harina

Sebastiana es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 44. She is widowed and has 2 grown children. She has her own home where she lives with her children. Her home is located in a hamlet in the Morropon district, Piura department.

Sebastiana sells beer and milled flour for making Chicha (a traditional Peruvian corn-and-flour-based drink). She has 6 years' experience with this business, and has gained experience and a fixed customer base for her business.

Sebastiana is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can expand her business, buying more beer and corn in large quantities, to process and convert to flour.

Sebastiana is a very diligent and hard-working person. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and corn in large quantities.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 1 child. 

Eladia has a shop that sells snacks, breads & noodles.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of noodles to sell.

Eladia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Eladia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of noodles to sell

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges tiene  51 años de edad, el tiene 01 hija en edad escollar,  cuenta con casa propia ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo  su domicilio por estar ubicado en una zona urbana y transitada , cuenta con todos los servicios básicos , como lo es agua , energía eléctrica y telefonía , entre otros 

Eduviges cuenta con un negocio en un mercado de la ciudad, ella  se  ha establecido en un puesto de comida y bebida en el interior del mercado, ella ofrece menú diariamente, desde hace 11 años, en todo este tiempo ella ha podido conseguir clientela  fija y fidelizada a su negocio 

Eduviges esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 3000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda , ella desea poder tener mayor seguridad y poder brindar a sus clientes más comodidad.

Eduviges quiere crecer como empresaria, cuenta con muy buenas referencias y muchas  ganas de salir adelante y poder brindarle a su  familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eduviges is 51 and has one school-aged daughter. She has her own home in the center of Chiclayo city. Her home has all of the basic services (water, electricity and phone, among others) because it is located in a busy, urban area.

Eduviges has a business in the city market. She has established a stall in the market where she sells food and drink. She offers a daily menu. She has done this for 11 years, and during this time she has been able to establish a fixed and loyal customer base.

Eduviges is requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She wants to have greater security and offer her customers more comfort.

Eduviges wants to expand as a businesswoman. She has very good references and a great desire to get ahead and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her business' facilities with metal structure and furniture.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Everlita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Everlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Everlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel who is married with two school aged children is now 40 years old.  He is a farmer who has been engaged in rice production for 30 years.  He is doing his best to improve his ways in farming to create more income. 

Samuel is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds of rice to be planted in his 1.0 hectare rice field and fertilizers (the organic kind made from animal manures) for the maintenance of his crop. 

By continuing to work towards the development of his farming, Samuel hopes to see his children finish their studies in college.  Furthermore, he is doing his best to uplift his family from their poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice to be planted in his 1.0 hectare rice field and fertilizers (the organic kind made from animal manures) for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 33 years old and single. She works hard to support her parents. Loida lives in the Philippines and runs a fish-selling business along with a general store to earn additional income. According to Loida, having two businesses helps her family a lot. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from ASKI.

Loida is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fish to sell. She will also use her loan to buy smoked fish to sell and increase her income. Loida hopes that her hard work will help attain her dream of saving enough money to have a family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh and smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Mr. Nhoek is a 45-year-old man who has been residing in Kompong Chhnang Province. The main income source of Mr. Nhoek comes from agriculture sector as a farmer since he was single. He is a widower man and currently lives with his five single children. Mr. Nhoek also relies on his child who work overseas. 

Although the rainy season is coming, Mr. Nhoek can't do anything on his farmland because one of his old cows cannot support him in the farm field. Therefore, Mr. Nhoek has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maychelle

texts.en:
Maychelle is 20 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Maychelle has run a shop where she sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. 

Maychelle is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy more canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maychelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cows and repair their old house.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
From Kompong Cham Province, Mr. Moa and his wife have been working in crop-planting for a long time. From this occupation, they can make an income of approximately $5 per day for  food expenses, utility expenses, education expenses and other vital expenses. 

Mr. Moa will be using the loan which he is asking for to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to start planting his crop during the rainy season. The couple has six children, all of whom are single and most of them are still attending public school..

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 35 years old and single. She lives in the Philippines. For the past year, Raquel is has been a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Raquel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and is married with four children. He lives in the Philippines. For the past 31 years, Jose has cultivated sugarcane on his farm. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.

Jose is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to improve his sugarcane farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his sugarcane field

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaenzi, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school. For the past four years, she has been running two businesses: she is food vendor and she sells paraffin for fuel. Mwanaenzi works from six in the morning through six in the evening and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She is a member of the loan group “Malengo,” which has 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

Mwanaenzi is requesting a loan to increase her sock of paraffin. This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy land, pay school and household expenses, as well as to start selling paraffin. Mwanaenzi has successfully repaid all of her loans. Her dream is to one day be able to buy more land.

loans.use: to incrase her stock of paraffin

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Cambodia is a developing country that depends on mostly farming. Men, who lives in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia, is a farmer. She and her husband have cultivated the same field for a long time, which has given them experience. Together, they make a daily profit of 2.5 USD to support their family. 

Mem is requesting a 100 USD loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm materials. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living and send her children to the university to gain knowledge and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Carmelita has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 34 years old, married and blessed with one child. 

His wife has a retailing business of cosmetics products while Ronnie is a farmer. He is engaged in growing rice and has been doing it for eight years.  They live in the Philippines.

Ronnie is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure, seeds of rice to be planted in his three hectares of farm and herbicides to protect his crops. 

He wants to improve and expand his business to increase his income, thus providing a better future for his family. He also dreams that his child could finish his studies and be able to get a good job someday. That's why he really works hard to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 45 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as shampoo, noodles, and canned goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

Johna has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Johna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 36, believes strong motivation and will power increase one’s chances of being a strong and successful entrepreneur and can be the basis for one to glide over business adversity and periods of burnout. 

The self-starting Jane set the ball rolling in her general merchandise retail trade three years ago in Kihihi in Western Uganda. Retail businesses are highly profitable this side of the country and many people involved in them have been able to improve their circumstances and their families' standards of living.

For Jane, a happy-go-lucky mother of three, this has principally unfolded because she has established strong working relationships with a variety of people, mostly her customers, over the years.

She has also been good at making pivotal decisions and organizing her finances, all aimed at strengthening her business. 

At her shop she sells a variety of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, jerrycans, rice, beans, cooking oil, eggs, etc.

Her strong business notwithstanding, her achievements and strides have been afflicted by inevitable cost issues, lack of sufficient stock when demand is high and envy.
 
She has weathered most of those storms rather successfully and she anticipates that better horizons will open up in the not-so-far future. This, she believes, will happen if she does not rest on her laurels.

Weekly, her gross sales profits are to the tune of UGX 300,000, and she says the purpose of this Kiva loan is to aid her in the purchase of more high-demand retail commodities such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, bread, rice and beans to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, bread, rice and beans to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von is a 28 year-old rice cultivator in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She has been planting rice crop and potato since 2003 and earns approximately $1 per day. She works together with her husband in the same business. In addition, they also buy a small amount of vegetables from the other villagers to sell in the market to supplement their farming income.  They have three single children who they support.  Mrs. Von would like to ask for a loan to buy potato seeds for planting during the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and is married with four children. Her oldest child is 26 years old and the youngest is 21. For the past 26 years, Jocelyn has been a farmer, growing rice and corn. She works hard to provide for her family's needs and send her children to school.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a stable income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cherrylou

texts.en:
Cherrylou is 32 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Cherrylou has run a retail shop where she sells t-shirts, blouses, and short pants. She is a new member of HSPFI.  

Cherrylou is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Judith has run a shop where she sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She is a new member of HSPFI.

Judith is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 51 years old and married with four children. For the past 30 years, he has been a rice farmer working in the Philippines. He earns an average of 50,000 PHP each harvest season during the months of April and November.

Benjamin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and herbicide to use in his farming. He will also use his loan to buy crude oil to maintain the hand tractor he uses to till his rice field. He hopes that this loan will increase his rice production. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, herbicide, and oil to maintain his hand tractor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and her youngest is only 8. Jocelyn's husband works as a farmer and driver, and she makes a living by growing rice on a field she and her husband own in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Jocelyn does her best to keep their farm productive, and continually hopes and prays for the good health of her family. She is applying for this loan to buy five sacks of seeds, four sacks of fertilizer and one quart of herbicides. Jocelyn is hoping that his loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Rosita has a retail shop that sells vegetables such as string beans. She has run this business for three years. Rosita has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Rosita is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 40 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old.
Juvy is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 18 years. She and her husband now own a rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. According to Juvy, they earn about 10,000 PHP per month from their farming business. Juvy has requested a loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. Juvy hopes that her business will help to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alfanus

texts.en:
Alfanus is a farmer in  the Nyamira area of South Rift, Kenya. He is aged 51 and has been in farming for 27 years, employing six farmhands on a casual basis. His farm produces tea, coffee, milk and maize. He is married with eight children, two of whom are still schooling.

Alfanus has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorcycle for the transport business. He say the business will enable him to pay school fees and uplift the living standards of the family. He hopes to develop the transport business and buy a vehicle.

Alfanus says farmers are experiencing prolonged drought which reduces their production and income.

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle

loans.name: Khive

texts.en:
Mrs. Khive is a widow, age 54, living in Baray district, Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Although she hasn’t a husband to help her, she is the main breadwinner in her family.

Mrs. Khive is the mother of three kids and is a vermicelli seller in her village. Seeing the hardships of their mother, all three kids have found suitable work to do in Phnom Penh. With their help it makes it easier for Mrs. Khive to live than in the past. 

After she discussed it with all her children, Mrs. Khive wishes to borrow  the amount of $1,100 in order to expand her business and purchase goods to sell at her own house.

loans.use: To purchase goods and rice to sell at her own house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Adelina has a pigpen from which she sells grown and matured pigs. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. Adelina is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 43 years old and has been engaged in rice farming for more than 21 years. She is married with three children aged 21, 16 and 4. Lani now owns and tills a plot of land with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell to rice traders. Lani works hard to feed her children and send them to school. She also does her best to keep their farm productive.
Lani has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She wants to become a successful businesswoman some day.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a father of three school-aged children. His spouse is a housewife. He is now 44 years old.
Florencio is a simple farmer working in the Philippines. He wants a loan amount of 27,000 PHP to acquire farm inputs needed in his farming business such as fertilizers, rice seed and insecticides. Florencio will also use some of the loan to pay the labor fees of his hired laborer in sowing, pulling and transplanting rice in the field. In the future, he will exert his best effort to increase his farming income so that someday his family will become economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, rice seed and insecticides.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has five children and makes a living by selling vegetables. She has been in business for a year and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables for sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Maja is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 20. 

Maja is a farmer who owns and works a property in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and sells her harvest at the market. Maja also buys and resells coconuts. Maja works hard to help provide for her family's needs. 

Maja is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and other farm supplies. Maja is hoping to start another small business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages, & snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks. 

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has seven children. 

Juanito has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, & food seasoning. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Juanito is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has eight children. She is 59 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Gertrudes has had a piggery for two years. She has requested 7000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase more pigs. 

Gertrudes has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for his restaurant.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has two children and makes a living by selling canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has been in business for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Uok

texts.en: To be responsible, Mrs. Uok, 58, and her husband always think of strategies to succeed in life. To help the family prosper, Mrs. Uok sells groceries in a market near her commune. Her husband oftE. helps her. The couple has three childrE. and they earn $5 per day. Mrs. Uok has seE. her business improve from day to day. She would like to request a loan of $325 in order to purchase more groceries.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 45 years old, married and has five children. She works as a farmer who tills a plot of land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband work together on their farm, where they grow rice to sell to their customers. She is applying for a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, five quarts of herbicide and other farm supplies. She hopes to improve her farm and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is a dedicated mother who works hard to give her three children a better life. She makes a living by running a general store where she sells different commodities, including coffee, milk, candies, sugar, condiments and snacks. Her husband works as a farmer. Valentina has applied for a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers, and hopes to expand her small shop into a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, sugar and spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 59 and married. He has a small piggery in their backyard. From this business he is earning an average of P12,000 every four months of selling his fattened pigs. He has been doing this type of business for four years now. 

His wife works as a dressmaker to help him earn an income for their daily needs. Juan is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy feed for his pigs. He dreams of growing his business to earn a bigger income so they can repair their house. It was destroyed by typhoon "Juan" (the international name of this storm was "Megi")last year.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the items her store sells.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Sangijon

texts.ru: Сангижон проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 55 лет. Она вдова, имеет одного ребенка. У нее среднее образование. После смети мужа, она занялась бизнесом. На сегодняшний день у нее имеется продуктовый магазин. В торговле ей помогает ее дочь. Она берет кредит для покупки молочных продуктов и колбасных изделий. Сангижон хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Sangijon lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 55 years old, a widow and has one child.  She has a secondary education.  Following the death of her husband, she started her own business.  Today, Sangijon has a food market.  Her daughter helps her with the sales.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dairy and sausage products.  Sangijon wants to expand her product selection.

loans.use: to purchase dairy and sausage products

loans.name: Hermelenda

texts.en:
Hermelenda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Hermelenda has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the items her store sells.

Hermelenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Hermelenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Mary Louvi

texts.en:
