For the past year, he has operated a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of inflation because of the high cost of fuel. He dreams of improving his living standards in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to establish another business buying and selling goats. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To establish another business buying and selling goats.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with four children; two attend school while two are underage. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years he has operated a photographing business, operating from door to door; his potentials customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge in competition from other photographers. He dreams of expanding his business to cover a larger market area in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Omar wants to purchase a digital camera. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera.

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en: Johannes is 25 years old and single with no children. He runs a provision and beverage shop in Lumley – a neighborhood in Freetown. He has been in this business for three years and sells sugar, milk, bread, cigarettes and soft drinks at his store. His business is the main source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of sufficient financing for him to expand. He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and soft drinks. Johannes says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to import goods from abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, cigarettes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Juana habita en el municipio de amigos de Holanda, tiene 47 años tiene 3 hijos menores mayores de edad que trabajan de manera independiente. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. Trabaja todos los días de la semana ya que la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda,  ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños, calzado y cosméticos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Juana lives in the Amigos de Holanda municipality. She is 47 and has 3 grown children who work independently. She sells general merchandise, and started this business out of a need to work and improve her family's living conditions. She works every day, since her business is in her home. She sells her merchandise on credit and charges every fifteen days. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing, shoes and cosmetics. Her dreams are to continue growing and continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a single man who lives at a family house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is clothing. For the past year, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a grocery business in the future. With the Kshs 10,000, Hussein wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en: Katiba is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. For the past ten years, he has operated a carpentry business; his potential customers are neighbours and restaurant operators. His greatest challenge is the delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of expanding his business to improve his lifestyle. With the Kshs 10,000 Katiba wants to purchase timber and carpentry tools. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
LA  SRA MARIA DEL CRAMNE  CON 63  AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA CON UN HIJO  ,ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO DIVINA MISERICORDIA .CARMEN DESDE YA UN BUEN TIEMPO SE DEDICA  AL NEGOCIO DE INTERNET E IMPRENTA , EL LOCAL DONDE TRABAJA  ES ALQUILADO Y TRABAJA TODOS LO DIAS  DE LUNES A SABADO  DESDE LAS 8 DE LA MAÑANA  HASTA LAS 10 DE LA NOCHE .LA SRA  MARIA DE CARMEN  SOLICITO EL  PRESTAMO PARA PODER INVERTIR MAS EN SU NEGOCIO Y PODER COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA .EN EL FUTURO ELLA QUISIERA PODER TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL  DE NEGOCIO .
 LAS SRA MARIA DE CARMEN ESTA UBICADA A LADO  DERECHO DEL SEÑOR  DE CAMISA .MARIA DEL CARMEN VISTE UNA CHOMPA ANARANJADA  Y PANTALON DE VESTIR COLOR PLOMO
texts.en:
Sra. Maria del Carmen is 63 years old, single, and has one child. She is a member of the group “Divina Misericordia” (Divine Mercy). For some time, Carmen has managed an Internet and printing business from a rented location. She works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 10pm.

Sra. Maria del Carmen is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy more merchandise. In the future, she hopes to have her own location for her business. Sra. Maria del Carmen is standing to the right of the gentleman wearing a shirt. She is wearing an orange sweater and dark-colored pants.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ethleem

texts.en: Ethleem is 48 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 23. She runs a stationery store in Aberdeen — a neighborhood in Freetown. She is the bread winner in her family, and also takes care of two relatives and their families. Ethleem has owned this business for 12 years and sells books, pens, paper, photocopying and scanning at her place of business. She also earns income from renting a house to tenants. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to expand. She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more text books, desk top computers, and stationery. Ethleem says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and standard of living. In the future, she hopes to open an Internet cafe and extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase more text books, desk top computers,and A4 paper

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
Chernor is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 25. He runs a clothing store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown.

Chernor has been in this business for seven years and sells both male and female dresses. He also earns income from renting a house to tenants. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing items.  Chernor says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to expand his business to a boutique level.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chibendo

texts.en:
Chibendo is a married man with four children. One child attends school and the other three are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a restaurant business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Chibendo dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase cereals, maize flour, furniture tables and jugs. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, maize flour, furniture tables and jugs.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 2 and 11. The eldest two are in school and she runs a general store with her husband.

For the past three years, she has been running the store, which sells maize flour, salt, sugar, and other goods.  The success from this business has enabled her to feed her family.  

She will use this loan to purchase more goods that she will sell in the store.  This will allow her to continue to earn profits that will provide for the well-being of her family and accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop such as maize flour, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, shoes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Flor De Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CIELO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Luiza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda, ayudante de albañil, venta de verduras, venta de papa, venta de fruta, venta de zapatos, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Luiza  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de frutas) que comprará de los mayoristas de la calle de Villa Dolores. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Cielo” (Flower of Heaven) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Luiza. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as managing a store, working as a masonry assistant, selling vegetables, selling potatotes, selling fruit, selling shoes, and selling groceries.

Sra. Luiza says this is her first loan cycle while working with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a promoter. Luiza currently has a business selling fruit and started working three years ago.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital for purchasing fruit, which she acquires from the wholesale vendors along Villa Dolores Street. Working in this manner makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family. Luiza is in a common-law relationship and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Luiza said she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling furniture from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the wedding season, he gets lots of customers in his business. He dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase timber for his workshop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
MwaZ. is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. 

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Ali faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business, Ali wants to purchase timber to make beds for sale with a loan of Kshs 10,000. He dreams of expanding to establish a workshop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber to make beds for sale.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is now 33 years old. Together with his wife, he works to improve their income from business. His wife has been selling a variety of products like spices, canned goods and some crackers and candies in her store located in the village where they live for almost five years now. Jomar is working as a company driver. 

Jomar is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 that he will use to buy groceries such as soft drinks, bread, ingredients, canned goods and noodles to sell for his wife to sell in the store. This couple is able to earn an average total of PHP 3,000 each month. 

In the future, Jomar wants to work harder for the improvement of their livelihood towards a living that is free from hunger.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, bread, ingredients, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with seven children. Five of the children attend school and two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer for her studies.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.en: Mariluz is 27 years old and married with two children. She has two sons who are 8 and 10 years old. She is a housewife who takes care of her two boys and tends to the house. Mariluz is asking for a loan so that she can buy a vehicle for her family. They do not currently have a car and desire access to greater mobility that a new car would bring. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a car for her family

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing products in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with seven children. Five of the children attend school and two are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and fuel.

For the past five years, he has operated a carpentry business selling household furniture to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of a timber shortage. Hassan dreams of purchasing a grinding machine in the future.

With the KSHS 25,000, he wants to purchase timber for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his business.

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.en: Margarita Cortona is 66 years old and married with four children. One of her children still lives with her while he studies in University and the others live separately. Margarita worked as a docent but currently she is unemployed. She is asking for a loan in order to help pay for her son's University tuition. Her son is 22 years old and attends the National University of San Antonio Abad Cusco. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el ciclo número seis en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Martha quien se encuentra de vestida con manta blanca.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: atención de cafetería, venta de cosméticos, portería, costura de mandiles, venta de comida, venta de salchipapas, chofer.
 
La señora Martha indica que hace seis años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo harina, etc.). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene  tres hijos.

En la fotografia no encontramos a Don Enrique porque su cultura no le permite; pero acompaña al grupo la prima de una de las socias
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor Kantuta” is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Martha, the woman wearing a white shawl over her dress. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as managing a cafeteria, selling cosmetics, working as a caretaker, sewing aprons, selling food, selling “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), and working as a chauffeur.

Sra. Martha says that she joined a Communal Bank and Pro Mujer six years ago after receiving an invitation. She currently has a business in which she sells food.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, noodles, flour, and other items. Working in this manner makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family. Martha is single and has three children.

In the photograph, Don Enrique does not appear because his culture does not allow it. However, a cousin of one of the members does appear with the group.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Majiti

texts.en:
Majiti is a married man with six children. Five of his children attend school and one has graduated from school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five months, he has operated a business selling milk from door to door to his neighbors. He also operates a poultry business, which contributes to his other source of income. Majiti faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during hot seasons when the production of milk is low. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase milk to sell and poultry chicks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase milk to sell and poultry chicks.

loans.name: Zosi

texts.en:
Zosi is a married woman with six children. Five of the children attend school and one has completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the delay of delivery of goods in the market. She dreams of expanding her business to establish another grocery in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is 58 years old and married with one son. He works as a taxi driver in the city of Cusco. Fidel works everyday driving throughout the city and he really enjoys his job. He is asking for a loan in order to improve his taxi. He plans to purchase new tires and fix any scratches or smashes on his taxi. He is very proud of his car and this loan will help him to continue to take great care of it. Fidel is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 46 años, esta casado y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes son el motivo de trabajar y entrar a todo negocio que le sea conveniente. EL trabajo de Ángel se divide en dos cosas, ya que él es un abogado y tiene su estudio jurídico en la ciudad, pero como una actividad extra es la que realiza en su casa, pues se dedica a la compra y venta de bebidas heladas, ya que tiene un buen mercado en la calle en la que vive. Cuando él no está, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposa quienes se quedan a cargo de la venta de las bebidas. Lo que mas le gusta es que genera un ingreso extra y lo que no le gusta es que a veces se van a comprar a altas horas de la noche y por el bien del negocio tiene que atender. Espera poder formar una distribuidora y quizá mas adelante poder hacer en su casa su propio consultorio jurídico. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera poder seguir con la responsabilidad que ha mostrado hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará bebidas y parte del crédito también lo utilizará para el arreglo de su oficina.
texts.en:
Ángel is 46 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, who give him the motivation to work and engage in any convenient business. Ángel divides his time between two businesses. He is a lawyer and has his own law practice in the city, but he also has another business that he manages at home. Ángel buys and sells cold beverages because there is a good market for these products on the street where he lives. When he is not at home, his wife and children are left in charge with selling drinks. What he enjoys most is being able to generate extra income. However, he does not like it when customers occasionally come late at night to buy drinks, but he allows it for the good of the business. He hopes to become a distributor and later on set up his law practice at home.

This is his second loan with MFP. Ángel hopes to continue in the responsible manner that he has demonstrated so far. The loan he requested will be used to buy beverages, but part of the money will also be used to remodel his office.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and to remodel his office.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo has been working as a farmer in the Philippines for four years. He hopes to increase his earnings from his business to uplift his family from their poor living conditions. 

He is now 33 years old and married with three young children. In farming, Domingo is earning PHP 20,000 every harvest season during the months of April and November, yearly. His income always goes to his family needs and the allowances of his children in school. 

He hopes to borrow PHP 10,000 to use as added capital to buy fertilizers and hybrid rice seed to maintain his farm. To ensure his family's economic stability, Domingo is doing his best to improve the production of his crop yearly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hybrid rice seed

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with seven children. Five of his children attend school and two have already graduated from school. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past nine years, he has operated a business of selling palm wine made from coconut. He sells at wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot dry season, the availability of coconut is lower in the market. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more profits in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to make palm wine. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts to make palm wine

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is 52 years old and married with three children. She has one boy and two girls. Two of her children still attend University. Norberta is a housewife, spending her time taking care of her children and tending to the house. She is asking for a loan in order to help pay for the education of her daughter who attends University. She is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to help pay for her daughter's university education

loans.name: Mwachupa

texts.en:
Mwachupa is a married man with six children; three attend school while three already graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, he has operated a local brew-selling business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of low profits in the business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a goat-meat selling business.  

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to start a goat-meat business and purchase goats. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a goat-meat business and purchase goats.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir la siembra de su cafetal. El cuenta con un terreno establecido en un área de excelentes condiciones para la producción, por lo cual opto por repoblar el cultivo. El piensa establecer un cafetal en muy buenas condiciones para la producción de café esta próximas cosecha y así generar ganancias. El tiene como meta generar los ingresos necesario para salir adelanta con su familia y con los pagos del crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael is 39 years old and married. He lives with his wife and four children who are his greatest priority. Rafael intends to use this loan to buy supplies for planting coffee. He has a plot of land in an established area that has excellent conditions for production. For this reason, he chose to plant this crop. Rafael plans to establish a coffee plantation with very good conditions for production in subsequent harvests so that he can generate revenue. His goal is to earn the necessary income to move his family forward and repay his loan.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Rafael has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting coffee.

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSCO SUR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose; el tiene 38 años D. edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. transporte, el tiene una movilidad D. mudanza, el tiene una camioneta que realiza mudanzas y también se dedica a la publicidad D. diferentes instituciones tanto privadas y públicas, el socio trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio D. estos trabajos saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. transporte y también negocio D. publicidad, por medio D. estos trabajos el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio D. transporte y mejorar el servicio D. mudanza. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento D. su carro, para vender repuestos para su camioneta.
                                               
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. lavado D. carros, negocio D. transporte, negocio D. venta D. artesanía, negocio D. venta D. frutas, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Cusco Sur” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sr. Jose. He is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Jose divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He owns a vehicle, a truck that is used for moving. Jose also does advertising for different private and public institutions. He works from 7am to 6pm. Through these business activities, he is able to help his children get ahead. Jose wants to expand both his transportation and advertising businesses because they allow him to move his children forward. For this reason, he wants to improve his transportation business and proviD. better moving services. The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle and buy parts for his truck.

Jose is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments. The other members have businesses that involve washing cars, providing transportation services, selling handicrafts, selling fruit, and selling groceries.

Jose is grateful to those who helped fulfill this part of his dream, so he promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and spare parts for the truck used in his moving business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past five months, she has operated a grocery business selling from home to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with seven children. Four of her children attend school and three have completed school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of low turn out of customers because of the rise in the economy. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and educate her children,

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Console is a 52-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 19 and 23.  One child has finished primary school and the other two are still completing their studies. Her husband works as a farmer.

For the past 30 years, she has sold a local drink called urbushera, which is made from sorghum. This successful business has enabled her to feed her children and improve her family’s standard of living. 

She will use this loan to purchase more sorghum from which she will make more urbushera.

She hopes to earn enough profits to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es vecino de la comunidad de las Bonitas de Platanares, en Pérez Zeledón, de la provincia de San José. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito. 
El está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), esto para la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. 
Incrementar el negocio para que su microempresa crezca cada día mas y darles a sus clientes lo mejor a la hora en que sus cerdos estén listos.  El negocio de Walter inicio como un nuevo ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia, y así darles un mejor estudio a sus hijos.  Su meta es poder darle final a todos sus proyectos cumpliendo con sus expectativas.
 Es su tercer préstamo y expresa que se siente muy a gusto de formar parte de esta organización. Walter es parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas y nos  ha dicho que ser socio de esta empresa ha sido una excelente opción para obtener su crédito ya que es más fácil y rápido el trámite.
texts.en:
Walter is a resident of the community of Las Bonitas de Platanares, in Pérez Zeledón, San José Province. Agriculture is the main business activity that occurs in this area. Most of the residents of this region are both coffee growers and livestock breeders.

Walter is requesting a loan in the amount of 600,000 CRC so that he can buy concentrated feed for fattening his pigs. He wants to increase his business so that his micro-enterprise will grow more each day. This will allow him to provide his customers with the best product whenever his pigs are ready to be sold. Walter’s business was started as a new source of revenue so that he could improve the quality of life for his family and provide the best education for his children. His final goal is to meet the expectations of all of his projects.

This is his third loan and he expresses his delight in being part of his credit organization. Walter is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Las Bonitas. He says that becoming a member of this organization was an excellent decision because obtaining a loan is an easier and faster process.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.name: Mirian Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos casados y 2 hijas en etapa escolar; Mirian se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para la venta; dedicándose a este negocio por más de 10 años, siendo madre soltera se dedico al negocio para mantener a sus hijos; la Sra. Mirian gana como un aproximado de S/ 300 soles semanales por la venta de sus cerdos. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo padrillo para poder así preñar a sus cerdas,  su principal desafío es el estar trabajando con cerdos  con lo cual esta  expensa a coger alguna enfermedad.  Su  sueño es comprar un terreno para hacer crecer su chanchería y así abarcar mas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian is a single mother with four children. Two of them are married and the other two are in school. Mirian raises pigs to sell and has been in this business for more than 10 years. Being a single mother, she started this business in order to support her children. Sra. Mirian earns approximately 300 PEN each week from the sale of her pigs.

This loan will be invested in a male pig so that she can impregnate her sows. Her greatest challenge in working with pigs is the expense related to treating diseases. Her dream is to buy a piece of land so that she can build a butcher shop and expand her market base.

loans.use: to purchase a male pig.

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.en: Angelica is 50 years old and married with three children. She is the owner of a small grocery store that sells a  variety of basic foods. Angelica is very proud of her grocery store and wishes to begin selling a wider variety of items. She is asking for a loan to purchase basic necessities to be sold in her store. Specifically, she plans to buy sugar, rice, and pasta. By selling more of these products, she hopes eventually to be able to buy a wider variety of products to sell. Angelica is a hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, and pasta for her grocery store

loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: Karla Isabel tiene 30 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, ella lucha por él y por proporcionarle los ingresos como alimento, vestimenta y estudios. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad económica pues además le proporciona los ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, tratamientos, cremas, lápiz labial, polvos, entre otros.
texts.en: Karla Isabel is 30. She sells cosmetics. She has had this business for over 3 years. She has one young child under her care. She fights for him, and to be able to offer him the necessities such as food, clothing and education. She is a very enterprising woman who benefits from this business as it provides her an income for her household. This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, treatments, creams, lip liner, and powders, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, treatments, creams, lip liner, and powders, among other items.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children. Five of her children attend school and two are still too young for school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of perishable food products leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with seven children: two girls and five boys. Six of the children attend school and one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a business selling tea leaves. He sells in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. His major dream is to expand his business and improve his lifestyle.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of tea leaves and pay for transport charges. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of tea leaves and pay for transport charges.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 45 años; la socia es casada; La socia tiene 3 hijos y ella se dedica a  la docencia, la socia es profesora de profesión y trabaja en un colegio desde hace 2 años; la socia en esta ocasión desea el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos, ella invertirá en los estudios de sus hijos, la socia desea pagara las mensualidades de estudios superiores en una sola cuota y de este modo lo que le ingrese de sus sueldo podrá destinarlos en los vivieres del hogar, pago de servicios y pagar la cuota del préstamo mensualmente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de mensualidades de sus hijos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda, 45, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children.  She’s a teacher by profession and has been employed at a school for two years now.  On this occasion she wants the loan to invest in her children’s education.  She will invest in her children’s schooling.  She wants to pay the monthly higher education fees in one payment so that what she earns from her salary can be used to buy food for the house, pay utilities and the monthly loan installment.  She is asking for the loan to invest in her children’s monthly fees.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support being provided to her by this means and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly tuition costs.

loans.name: Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLPANI” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, servicios y producción.
 
La señora Rosmery,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general que viene trabajando hace tres años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de harina, azucar, arroz, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente los venderá en la tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta convivir con las socias.

En la fotografía no se encuentra Julia ya que su religión no le permite.
texts.en:
The “Collpani” communal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Rosmery.  The members carry out a variety of businesses such as: commerce, service and production.

Rosmery indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for two years having joined through an invitation from her girl friends.  Currently she has a general store that she’s been operating for three years having learned from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (to purchase flour, sugar, rice, etc.).  She will buy it in La Ceja (commercial area of the city of El Alto) and then she’ll sell them in her store.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family however possible because she’s married and has two children.


When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes sharing time with her fellow members.

Julia does not appear in the photo because her religion does not allow it.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.en: Yaqueline is 27 years old and married with one daughter who is two years old. She works as a nurse at a local clinic in the city of Cusco. She is asking for a loan in order to pay for improvements to her house. She wishes to add an apartment to her house so that she can eventually rent it out. Specifically, she plans to purchase cement and wood planks in order to construct the apartment. Yaqueline is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for cement and wooden planks to build an extra apartment on her house

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin, tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado  y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir la siembra de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno vacio sin ningún tipo de plantación por lo cual realizara la siembra de café para utilizar el terreno y sacarle el mayor provecho. El quiere establecer  una plantación en condiciones buenas para así sacarle el mayor provecho al terreno. El tiene como meta obtener las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con el bienestar de su familia y generar un ahorro para su seguridad en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Martin, 40, is married and lives with his 3 children and his wife, who are his main priority.  With this loan he plans to buy supplies for his coffee crops.  He has some empty land that has nothing planted on it, and so he will plant coffee there to use the land and derive a benefit from it.  He wants to set in his crops under good conditions so that he can take maximum advantage of the land.  His goal is to obtain the earnings he needs to get ahead and provide for the well-being of his family.  He also wants to save to provide for his security in the future.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not taken loans previously from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Isatu.  She is married to a tailor and they have five children aged 2, 5, 8, 12 and 14 years old. In 1996, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business after realizing a substantial amount from her back yard gardening. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy Red Palm oil - 25 containers (125 gals.) @ Le 110,000 and Masankay Palm Oil - 15 containers (75 gals.) @ Le 80,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 255,000. In the future, Isatu plans to be a supplier by containers to her companions for retailing.  She also wants to open a store, hire a sales helper, and buy a commercial vehicle to help in transporting her palm oil goods from different production areas, especially in the Southern part of the country. She travels to different villages to get the palm oil and uses public vehicles once a month, but more frequently in the dry season. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase 25 containers of Red palm Oil and 15 containers of Masankay Palm Oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Tras muchos años de lucha Celinda sigue radicando en su pueblo natal, tiene  58 años y vive con su hijo en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez ha trabajado en las diversas tareas del campo y creció con los conocimientos básicos para poder defenderse en la vida. Desde su juventud y adultez la agricultura fue parte de su vida, permitiéndole sostener a su familia durante varios años. La constante capacitación que ha recibido durante estos 15 años ha logrado aplicarlo en sus terrenos de manera más tecnificada y así ha logrado aumentar su capital. De manera adicional se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 7 años, de las cuales significan más ingresos para mantenerse mientras espera los meses de crecimiento de sus plantas que son principalmente maíz, papa, cebolla, zanahoria y espinaca. En la actualidad el precio de los sacos de abono y las semillas de mejor calidad se han incrementado por lo que es necesario aumentar su capital de trabajo de la que actualmente dispone. Decidió crecer de la mano con MFP porque consideró que era una propuesta interesante para el progreso de su actividad y desde ese entonces ya tiene 11 oportunidades de las cuales solicita un crédito que siempre le ha servido para incrementar su capital de trabajo. En esta oportunidad el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en:
After many years of struggle Celinda still lives in her hometown.  She is 58 years old and lives with her son in her own house.  

Since childhood, she has worked in various tasks in the fields, and was raised with the basic knowledge of how to support herself in life.  Since her youth and adulthood, farming has been part of her life, allowing her to support her family for several years. The constant training she has received during these 15 years has been applied in her fields in an increasingly technical way and in this way she has been able to increase her capital.   

She also works raising and selling cattle, an activity that she has been doing for 7 years.  This activity provides more income to support herself while she is waiting for the months of growth for her crops, which are mainly corn, potato, onion, carrot and spinach.  

Currently the price of the sacks of manure and quality seeds have increased, making it necessary to increase her working capital beyond what she has currently available.  She has decided to grow hand in hand with MFP, because she felt it was an interesting proposition for progressing her business. Since then she has had 11 opportunities to apply for loans, which have always served to increase her working capital.  This time, she will invest the money requested in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio y mejorar el negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Vicentina is 60 years old. She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a restaurant.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  She is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand and improve the restaurant and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and commits to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mohamed.  He is married to a trader and has six children aged 2, 5, 8, 11, 16 and 21 years old. In 1981, Mohamed established his plastic slippers business. He began his business because he was a gold miner where he accessed his business capital and commerce trade in gold.  As his income continued to grow, he switched over to the sales of plastic shoes/slippers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le Le800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le Le5,000,000.  Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to buy Foam slippers - 10 pkts. @ Le60,000, Rosa slippers - 20 pkts @ Le70,000, and Bucket designed slippers - 5 @ Le400,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le Le300,000.  

In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a boutique, send his children to the U.S. to study and visit the Holy Land - Mecca.  He wants to get his goods from Conakry and be a supplier. Mohamed is now boasting of having a house and being able to buy goods in larger quantities.  Price inconsistency, weather, and tax/customs fees are his challenges. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastic slippers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, ella vende muñecas, polos, chompas, pantalones entre otras artesanías, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor como polos, muñecas y polos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the communal bank "Illary III."  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Margarita is 70 years old, married, and has 6 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She sells dolls, polo shirts, sweaters, pants and other handicrafts.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business she has provided for her children.  Margarita wants to expand her business selling handicrafts.  She requests a loan to buy products at wholesale such as polo shirts and dolls.

She is pleased with this loan, and promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and dolls to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edward, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir un almacigo de café que el tiene. El cuenta con un almacigo de café ya establecido y en crecimiento, el quiere realizarle una asistencia para mejorarlo. El con esta mejora lo que pretende es darle una ayuda extra a la planticas para así darle una mejor presentación y buena calidad para poder venderlo fácilmente cuando esté en condiciones de venta. El quiere sacarle las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante como persona y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en él futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edward, 32, is married and lives with his two children and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy supplies for a coffee seedling business he has.  He already has planted seedlings in production and he wants to do some enhancements to improve them.  What he wants to accomplish with this improvement is to give a little help to the plants to improve their appearance and quality so that they will sell easily when they reach proper conditions.  He wants to gain profits needed to continue forward as a person and to provide his family with a better quality of life in the future.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has gotten no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ysabel; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa y carteras, ella vende en forma independiente y junto con su hija realizan este negocio, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como instituciones o al publico al general, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y carteras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, chompas, carteras y casacas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ysabel, 57, is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling clothes and purses.  She sells independently with help from her daughter.  She takes her wares to various institutions or to the general public.  She is able to support her children through this small business.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy polo shirts, sweaters, purses and jackets at wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Aminata.  She is married to a secondary school leader and an experienced trader. She has four children aged 3, 7, 12 and 17 years old. In 1996, Aminata established her plastic slippers/sandals business. She began her business because when Aminata got married, her husband let her undertake the activity of selling plastic shoes while he established another trade in the oil palm plantation. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le Le1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le Le5,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy Adissa slippers- 10 @ Le120,000, Obama  slippers- 10 @ Le100,000, and Puma slippers- 5 @ Le300,000.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le Le270,000.  In the future, Aminata plans to establish another product by opening a bar for the sale of drinks, to visit the Holy Land - Mecca and to help her husband to construct a house on their land.  Aminata is always worried about sales in the rainy season, high transportation costs and taxes but she perseveres with all these challenges.  She travels to Freetown to purchase her goods by vehicle at least twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase plastic slippers/sandals

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia Maria es una madre de familia de 59 años, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el municipio de Nagarote. Lesbia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en este negocio y además de realizar financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 ella se dedica a una pulpería, ubicada en su vivienda para su mayor seguridad y comodidad, además puede atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, detergentes, fósforos, sal y granos básicos con la intención de que se incrementen sus ventas para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lesbia Maria is a 59-year-old mother. Her home has running water and electricity and is located in the Nagarote municipality. Lesbia has worked in this business and taken out loans from Fundacion Leon 2000 for a long time. She runs a convenience store in her home, for better security and comfort. This also means that she can serve her customers at any time. She has requested a loan for the purchase of candy, pop, bread, juice, detergent, matches, salt and basic grains, with the intention of increasing her sales in order to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase candy, pop, bread, juice, detergent, matches, salt and basic grains.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicenta; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de madera, ella vende madera para la fabricación de muebles, roperos, mesas, sillas y puertas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de madera. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Illary III". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of  Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Vicenta. She is 50 years old, single, and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her busienss buying and selling lumber. She sells lumber for the production of furniture, closets, tables, chairs, and doors. She works from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. It is throught this business that she is able to support her children. She wants to expand and improve her lumber sales business. She requests a loan to purchase lumber in wholesale.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase lumber in wholesale.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.en: Erasmo is 65 years old and married. He has four children, three of whom still live with him. He works as a farmer in his own fields, which are located behind his house. He primarily grows corn, but he also grows a small amount of other vegetables such as lettuce and cabbage. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer to grow corn. Erasmo is a very hardworking man and is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar y picantería que es como un restaurant pero mas tradicional, ella prepara comidas como cuy al horno, chancho al horno, rocoto relleno entre otros platos, al socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bar y picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y fideos y también gaseosa y cerveza al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the communal bank "Illary III."  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Yolanda is 41 year old, single, and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her bar/restaurant business.  In her eatery,  she serves traditional dishes.  She prepares meals such as roasted guinea pig, roasted pork, stuffed peppers, and other dishes.  She works from 9am until 6pm, and through this business she provides for her children.  Yolanda wants to expand her restaurant business.  She requests a loan to buy products to cook such as: meat, chicken, vegetables, and noodles.  She also wants to buy soft drinks and beer at wholesale.

Yolanda is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as: meat, chicken, vegetables, and noodles, and also to buy soft drinks and beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac, tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir un almacigo de café que él posee. El cuenta con un almacigo de café ya establecido para la venta y el quiere realizarle una asistencia para mejorarlo. El quiere darle a su plantación de café una mejor calidad con esa asistencia y así luego poder venderle a sus compradores un almacigo de condiciones buenas para aumentar cada año las  ventas. El se estableció la meta de aumentar la calidad del almacigo y así generar ganancias para su bienestar y la de su señora esposa,pensando enel futuro de ambos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isaac, 29, is married and lives with his wife who is his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies to use on his coffee seedling business.  He has a coffee seedling plantation already established for sale and he wants to assist it to improve it.  He wants to provide the coffee plantation with better quality with this help so that he will be able to sell the seedlings to his buyers in better condition and improve sales each year.  He set a goal for himself to improve the quality of his seedlings to generate profits for his and his wife’s wellbeing thinking of the future for both of them.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Manitos De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLPANI” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Delia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, servicios y producción.
 
La señora Delia,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta que viene trabajando hace veinte años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de fruta.) que adquirirá del municipio de Zorata y posteriormente lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el préstamo es fácil.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo la mprima de una de las socias que esta vestida de chompa roja.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Collpani" will start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Collpani. It is made up of nine members and it is directed by a board of directors led by Delian. The communal bank members' businesses are various and among them there are: commerce, services, and production.

Delia indicates that it has been with Pro Mujer for the past two years and she joined following an invitation by the representative. She currently has a business selling fruit and she has been in business for twnenty years. She learned the business from her mother.

The loan that she requests is to increase her business capital (fruit purchase) which will be acquired in the municipality of Zorata for later resale through orders. This business form helps her to generate an income to support her family in what's possible.  She is married common-law and she has two children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said she appreciates it for the easy loan process.

The cousin of one of the members can be seen in the photo accompanying the group. She is wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia prepara diferentes platos como estofado de carne, pollo al horno, rocoto relleno entre otros platos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras y implementar el restaurant como mesas y sillas.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana, 46, is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has five children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a restaurant.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She makes various dishes like meat stew, roasted chicken and stuffed peppers, among other dishes.  She works from 8am until 9pm.  She is able to support her children with this business.   She wants to expand and improve the restaurant.  She is asking for the loan to buy products to cook like meat, chicken and vegetables and to buy furnishings for the restaurant like tables and chairs.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook like meat, chicken and vegetables and to buy furnishings for the restaurant like tables and chairs.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne est mariée à un certain Constantin. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Julienne sont scolarisés. Julienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et subviennent ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Julienne a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Julienne fait l'élevage de lapins à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne vend des produits vivriers, du charbon de bois et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Julienne s'approvisionne dans l'un des grands marchés du Bénin. Julienne désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et construire plus de cages et de nids pour ses lapins ; raison pour laquelle Julienne sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui servira également à augmenter ses stocks de produits vivriers et de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Julienne is 38 years old. She lives in Benin. She is married to Constantin. They have four children in their care, two of whom are their own children. All children of Julienne are in school. Julienne and her husband live together with their children and jointly provided for various family needs. Julienne did not finish high school. About a dozen years ago she started raising rabbits. In addition to this activity, Julienne sells staple foods, charcoal, and phone cards. She stocks up at one of the big markets of Benin. Julienne would like to expand her business and have more cages and nests for her rabbits; this is why she is seeking her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will also allow her to stock up on staple foods and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, staple foods and charcoal,  and to build cages for rabbits

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariluz; la socia tiene 29 años; la socia; La socia tiene 1 hijo y ella se dedica a  la artesanía, la socia compra y vende artesanía, la socia también vende bisutería en la puerta de un hotel de forma ambulatoria, la socia elabora y compra artesanía, ella compra al por mayor de los proveedores y también realiza algunas piezas como aretes, pulseras, collares, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía y de materiales para la realización de bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar trabajos de artesanía.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 29, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank belonging to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a son and she makes crafts.  She is a crafts merchant.  She also sells costume jewelry in the door of a hotel.  She makes and buys crafts.  She buys from suppliers at wholesale and also makes some items like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.  She wants the loan to buy crafts and supplies to make costume jewelry.  She is requesting the loan to invest in supplies to make crafts.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support she’s being give through this means and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio, tiene la edad de 40 años, está en unión libre  y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra abonos y otros insumos para su cafetal. El cuenta  con un terreno ya establecido del cultivo desde varios años atrás, el quiere darle a su cafetal una buena asistencia abonándolo y fumigándolo para así obtener de él la mejor cosecha posible. El quiere con esta mejora a su plantación de café generar las ganancias más altas posibles y así darle a su esposa un nivel de vida más alto y asegurarse su futuro juntos.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 40 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife who is his main priority.  He plans to use this loan to buy manure and other supplies for his coffee plantation.  He has a plot of land which has already been sown with crops for several years.  He would like to provide care for his plantation, fertilizing it and spraying it so that he can obtain the best harvest possible.  He would like, through making this improvement, to earn the highest profits possible and thereby provide his wife with a better standard of living and guarantee their joint future.

This is José Antonio's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make improvements to his coffee plantation

loans.name: Sol De Cayumanqui Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Sol de Cayumanqui” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa para niños, venta de provisiones, atención en un kiosco, repostería y servicios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Sandra quien en la foto se encuentra en el lugar de al medio, vistiendo una chaqueta color gris, pantalones y cartera color negro y que además usa su cabello tomado. Se dedica a atender un kiosco que tiene ubicado en el patio de su casa, ahí vende preferentemente provisiones y confites. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace dos años. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas. Comenta que vende muchos confites y esto ha mantenido bien su negocio, sin embargo la venta de provisiones se ha dificultado debido a la competencia de los negocios. Su horario de trabajo es durante todo el día, y todos los días de la semana, de ésta manera no pierde clientela, ni ventas. 
Con el crédito comprará dulces, galletas, saborizantes para la leche, duraznos y pescado en conserva.
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar y generar mayores ingresos para aportar económicamente en su casa y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Sandra vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 19 y 9 años de edad. Su hija mayor se está preparando para rendir la prueba de selección universitaria en un preuniversitario, sus sueños es que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria, de esta manera acceder a un titulo profesional. Otro de sus sueños seria salir a vacacionar con toda su familia a diferentes lugares del país. 
Sandra está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios obtenidos por Fondo Esperanza y destaca con mucho orgullo los valores que se inculcan en la institución, como son la honestidad y solidaridad, para concretarlos en el grupo del Banco comunal. Comenta que ha aprendido de las capacitaciones, ya que ahora está generando estrategias para innovar en su negocio y de ésta manera captar un mayor número de clientes. De ésta manera incorporará la venta de mermeladas caseras y productos de repostería, que ella misma prepara. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sol de Cayumanqui” and is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of occupations.  Among them are: children’s clothing sales, grocery sales, running a kiosk, pastry making and services.  All of them are from the city of Chillán.

Sandra, who in the photo is in the middle wearing a gray jacket, black pants and purse and has her hair gathered up, runs a kiosk in her front yard where she sells groceries and snacks.  She’s been in this line of work for two years.  She buys her merchandise from suppliers and wholesale supermarkets.  She comments that she sells lots of snacks and that’s kept her business well.  However, selling groceries has been somewhat difficult because of competition.  Her work schedule is all day, every day of the week.  This way she does not lose any customers or any sales.  She will use the loan to buy candy, cookies, flavorings for milk, peaches and canned fish.  Her business goals are to prosper and to generate higher income to provide for her home economically and attain a better quality of life.

Sandra lives with her husband and two children who are 19 and 9 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is taking classes at a university prep school to get ready to take her university admission test.
